text.wiki:
The Sapporo Snow Festival (さっぽろ雪まつり, Sapporo Yuki-matsuri) is a festival held annually in Sapporo, Japan, over seven days in February. Odori Park, Susukino, and Tsudome are the main sites of the festival.
In 2007 (57th Festival), about two million people visited Sapporo to see the hundreds of snow statues and ice sculptures at the Odori Park and Susukino sites, in central Sapporo, and at the Satoland site. An International Snow Sculpture Contest has been held at the Odori Park site since 1974, and 14 teams from various regions of the world participated in 2008.The subject of the statues varies and often features an event, famous building or person from the previous year. For example, in 2004, there were statues of Hideki Matsui, the famous baseball player who at that time played for the New York Yankees. A number of stages made out of snow are also constructed and some events including musical performances are held. At the Satoland site, visitors can enjoy the long snow and ice slides as well as a huge maze made of snow. Visitors can also enjoy a variety of regional foods from all over Hokkaidō at the Odori Park and Satoland sites, such as fresh seafood, potatoes and corn, and fresh dairy products.Every year the number of statues displayed is around 400 in total. In 2007, there were 307 statues created at the Odori Park site, 32 at the Satoland site and 100 at the Susukino site. A good view of the creations can be had from the TV Tower at the Odori Park site.


== History ==
The Snow Festival began as a one-day event in 1950, when six local high school students built six snow statues in Odori Park. In 1955 the Japan Self-Defense Forces from the nearby Makomanai base joined in and built the first massive snow sculptures, for which the Snow Festival has now become famous. Several snow festivals existed in Sapporo prior to the Sapporo Snow Festival, however, all of these were suspended during World War II.On February 4, 1966, a flight from Sapporo to Tokyo crashed into Tokyo Bay killing all 126 passengers and 7 crew on board. Many of the passengers were returning to Tokyo after visiting the snow festival. Owing to the Energy crisis of 1974, snow statues were built using drums. This was due to the shortage of gasoline caused by the crisis and many of the trucks used to carry snow to the site were unavailable. In the same year, the International Snow Statue Competition started and since that year many snow statues built by teams from other countries have featured; especially from sister cities of Sapporo such as Munich.In years when the accumulated snowfall is low, the Self-Defense Force, for whom participation is considered a training exercise, brings in snow from outside Sapporo. The Makomanai base, one of three main sites from 1965, hosted the largest sculptures, with an emphasis on providing play space for children. Use of the Makomanai site was suspended in 2005 and moved to the Sapporo Satoland site located in Higashi-ku from 2006. In 2009, the Satoland site was moved to the Tsudome (つどーむ, Tsudōmu, Sapporo Community Dome) site. The Tsudome, located close to the Sapporo Satoland, is a dome for multiple sports events.Nakajima Park was established as one of the festival sites in 1990. However, it was removed as a site in 1992. The third site, known as the Susukino Ice Festival (すすきの氷の祭典, Susukino Kōri no Saiten), is situated in the night-life district of Susukino and includes predominantly ice carvings. The site was approved as one of the festival sites in 1983. Every year, the Susukino Queen of Ice, a female beauty contest, is held at the site.

text.quote: Iconic park full of flowerbeds & fountains, hosting frequent events throughout the year.
trip: Sapporo was our 1st Stop/City of the Rugby World Cup 2019 Tour and it was great. This Park had been truned into a massive Food & Drink Festival site, 'Free Entry', dozens of Options of foods from all over the World, though a strong emphasis on Japan, abetted by Drink options.

Visited after lunch with family. Pros: 1) Odori Park is a must visit when in Sapporo. It is a huge and clean park with traditional snacks, restaurants, soft service ice cream, a bubble man, and shopping malls. It is also where Sapporo TV tower is located. 2) My family had a

In Japanese it means "Large Street", it is the heart and backbone of Hokkaido's capital. Stretching 1.5 KM from East to West, it was originally planned to serve as main street of Sapporo but then it became a famous park where iconic festivals are held annually including the

We enjoyed viewing the many different ice sculptures and trying different foods and drinks that were offered. It was organized so that you traveled in one direction while walking around. There was also entertainment, photo ops, and souvenirs available.
Very well organised snow festival with lot’s of refreshments to buy plenty to see lot’s of activity all day long . Would definitely recommend to visit.

A park in central Sapporo. Plenty of exits from the subway will lead you here so you cant really get lost. Was lucky enough to be there during the Winter illumination period which makes the place more magical in the snow. Lots of pop up stalls serving various food items to

Odori Park is at the heart of Sapporo, where the festivals like the Autumn Festival and the Winter Festival are held. The park is around one mile (1.4 km) from end to end. You can get all sorts of goodies, I like the Hokkado beer best. When not covered by snow, Odori Park is
A lovely park to explore in the winter filled with snow. Can make snowman, throw snow balls or take lots of photos!
Hot wine, hot corn, ice cream, ramen and shopping mall just under the park. We were very exciting to see odori park in snow festival. Recommended.

Stretching approximately 1.5km from east to west, Odori Park is located in the centre of Sapporo. This is the place where many locals and park goers gather throughout the year and is used for various seasonal events. The Sapporo Snow Festival is held yearly and one of the

A great place for park lovers and revelers. This park is very long from east to west. A view from atop of the sapporo tv tower is the main highlight of this park from summer to winter. In winter, the long stretch of this park is one of the venue during the SAPPORO SNOW FESTIVAL

Visited snow sculptures while they were being prepared and then at completion a few days later for the light shows. I thoroughly enjoyed seeing the before and after. I also thought the smaller sized international snow sculpture competition was outstanding. The venue and
When I visited during August, the avenue was filled with beer gardebs offering beer and snacks, and it was really packed with people drinking and having fun.

We went to Odori Park and experienced the beautiful Christmas light-up at the park which was covered with thick snow as it had been snowing heavily that day. There was a German Christmas market going on and it was very crowded with locals and tourists. There were several quaint
A nice park in the middle of the city. Many performances on weekends. There are many malls and restaurants nearby. You can never go bored or hungry.
Did my morning jogs up & down the park...with fresh plantings of the spring flowers and potted plants. Simply rejuvenating to take in the smell & sights.

Winter lights display and European style Christmas market make for an interesting walk. The European style Christmas market offerings were very expensive compared to Germany. Rug up – it is very cold!

It's basically some greenery between two busy roads, decorated by lights, installations and vendors. Went there during heavy snow and it's still buzzing with people.Great place to relax and feel the seasonal vibe.
Great fun, in the center of everything... it was abuzz with the modeling of Snow Festival architecture. Hope to visit in autumn and spring.
This park is located in the city centre. It has beautiful flowers and a fountain. Lovely place to just relax and have a picnic.

We were there during the annual Hokkaido autumn festival, and it was the highlight of our trip! The whole park is decked out with vendors - dozens or hundreds of them - featuring everything from snack food to entrees to liquor and beer, all the way to countless numbers of
We came here at night and saw the beautiful Christmas lighting. There was a Christmas market too. It was really and felt like somewhere in an European city.
Was here for Christmas illumination. Snow were falling with the illumination. Great place for vacation. Odori Christmas market open in Dec. Very crowded with street food.
We went here on a winter night and despite the freezing temperature, we enjoyed our stay. The winter illumination is fantastic and the various fountains are good photo spots.
With lawns, statues, fountains, and a pleasant walking environmenþ there is much to love here. It is close to many things and always has the TV tower to tell you the time.
A good evening out at this big park having nice food and drinks.. a wonderful range to choose from... an event not to be missed if you are in Sapporo during September..
This is a big park and going all the way, long walk with a lot of famous sightseeing place alongside, like TV tower and clock tower.

We visited during the annual Hokkaido Autumn festival and the food offerings where amazing. Open 10am - 8pm daily, so much choice from 179 prefectures in Hokkaido for food and drinks. Seating offered, many public toilets, green gardens, flower beds, water features it was such a
We came to Sapporo for the rugby World Cup and they had this big section corned off for fans to watch the games that weren’t in Sapporo. Really nice area in the day time and at night.

We have sited Odori Park during the Ice Festival and it was a delight. This time the most of the place was geared up as a Fanzone fir the World Cup and it worked really well. Enjoyed the pre-game meeting at the park before making our way to stadium. The normal park
Odori Park is a beautiful park with nature and flowers in midst of the bustling city life. Its a spacious park for relaxation, photography, and nature.
This is a beautiful, well manicured park. There were families and friends enjoying this beautiful park and the surrounding landmarks like the Sapporo TV Tower.
A narrow strip of green grass and sweetly maintained colorful flowers, the trees were just beginning to turn when we visited. A nice break from the steel and concrete of the city.
Great park and fan zone for RWC 2019! Numerous food, wine, beer and sake vendors! Hope to return late January/early February for Snow Festival!
plenty of food and interesting drink stalls A great place to socialise in during the games. Have no idea what it's like when there's no RWC.

Visited during RWC 2019 and there was the Autumn food festival in full swing. Fantastic vibe for a sporting event. Food is great especially the ramen (not always cheap so look around). Used park for early morning run. Go up the tower for great views of the park from up

The food and drink festival is on for the month. Huge choice of food and drink. Stall prices are all similar - not cheap but reasonable. Everyone was so friendly and limited English made it a fun interaction as my Japanese is rubbish........such a good time with smiles all round
Went here during the rugby world cup. Has a good atmosphere with a lot of stalls and is near the sapporo tv towet

A Long linear park next to the TV Tower. Just green grass with intermittent flower beds with colourful flowers and some benches. The annual food festival just started on 6 Sep. There are 20 plus food tents set up selling all sorts of delicious Japanese food. Worth visiting to

Odori Park is a linear park placed on the wide median strip of a major thoroughfare in Sapporo. It is over a kilometre long and boasts pleasing flower beds and grassed areas. It is also a venue for many events - one was being set up at the time of our visit.
A comfy to walk park in summer with a tv tower as a observation deck for sight seeing. At night, the tower got its light on and the vibe is chill and nice to hang around with family or friends.

We kept walking at the park weather was very good just sit and admiring it ... Japanese are very polite and clean at the park you can’t find any paper or garbage on the floor .. beautiful colors of flower ..lots of ppl sit and have corn or ice cream
It’s a park that stretches a couple of streets. It is relaxing to stroll down the park and stop to admire the flowers or feel the wind in your hair
6 beer gardens lined up long the park. Should have come along in the evening. Great children play area at one end with water features
A lot of people go to this park to sit and relax. The park is very clean and well maintained. This place is good for walking, day or not. There is also a place to for drinking and eating.

A wonderful park to see and spend sometime to relax. There are lots of flowers, water fountains and place to eat. Easy to commute because the train and bus station are there. A well maintained and clean park.

After travelling all the way up the country in an attempt to catch a glimpse of what sakura trees were left at the end of the season, I was not disappointed! Odori park is a lovely and well kept park with pay areas for kids, fountains, vending machines and plenty more. We really

In summer this park is very beautifully decorated with flowers and water in fountains. In winter it’s spectacular because of YUKI MATSURI, festival of snow and ice. But when we were there this time in March, there was nothing special. There were still snow so it was cold but

A beautiful longitudinal park in the center of Sapporo with the TV Tower overlooking from one end. We stopped by there several times to rest from all the walking. Just to sit there and look at the flowers was more than enough. We also managed to catch a small flower market in
Just in front of Sapporo TV Tower. But everything is white when we go at winter .... On the middle of Feb you can see the sapporo ice festival there ...
Nothing spectacular just a walking area it’s nice a tourist information center in the tower. They have ice but super sweet. They have Genghis Kan Beer Garden smelled yummy.
Long park has lots of trees and flowers around. Elderly people to have a picnic there and office people to take a lunch break there. Beautiful landscaping is relaxing.

The Odori Park has a nice ambience for family, couple and solo travel. Come in Summer and you will find yourself immersed in the sweet scent of the flower display. The park is clean and have amenities like toilet and water fountain at regular interval. It also provide easy

We visited Odori Park towards the middle part of May but right before the Lilac Festival. There were a few lilac trees in bloom and many more flowers, including tulips, roses at the rose garden, and even one or two cherry blossom trees still in bloom. It was a nice stroll on a

The playground in Odori Park is a great size for my 2year old. Baby swings- 5 different types of slides, a splash river( which can easily be avoided) all under a wonderful canopy of Trees. The other parts of the park are nice too: a rose garden, lots of water fountains and

We really enjoyed this park in the middle of the city. The flowers and trees were beautiful, the fountain was nice, and the spring weather made it perfect to sit outside. There are some food stands (corn, ice cream, etc.) and, of course, vending machines. We ended up staying

We visited on late winter season and everything was still dead. It's not the Odori Park I imagined it woukd be. So it would be best of you could visit during mid-winter and mid spring season. The ice are already hard and melting when we visited and there were no leaves on the
The place was really nice. Flowers was everywhere and the park was so clean. Smoking area was available. Parking, though expensive, can easily be found near it.

Went here for a business meeting. But when I saw the festival, it’s so awesome. Ramen for less than $20. Wine and beer for less. Milk ice cream is the best. Other food includes yakitori and of course, corn! So yummy!

This friendly garden is located in one of the big cities in Japan. Nice place to hang out with friends. In some seasons, there are local festival held during the day such as beer festival or snow festival. Many shops, restaurants and shopping shops selling many things. Also

We went to the annual ramen festival in odori park during it’s opening day. Good weather, not too crowded, about a dozen different ramen booths with another dozen non ramen vendors. A block away a wine festival is also going on. I tried the miso based ramen special with pickled

This is regarded as a landmark of Sapporo because the famous Sapporo annual Snow Festival is held here in the park. Apart from that, there is not much very special. There are the usual water features, flower beds and chairs for pedestrians to rest their feet. I do not fancy it

We went there in end April under an extremely good weather. Very beautiful park with cherry blossoms to see if you're there at the right time - we were there slightly earlier than the sakura season in Hokkaido but managed to spot a few trees that have blossomed. There are some
丸井今井で惣菜を買って、芝生の上でピクニックしています。 夏の風物詩、焼とうもろこし（焼きとうきび）のワゴンも始まりました。 Picnic with a nice breeze. The poem about summer in Sapporo = Baked sweet corn stand has opened.
Though it was drizzling & cold, we enjoyed strolling around Odori Park , convenient & walking distance from Odori Station !

Unfortunately when I was there (early March) the snow was melting, so it made the park look very dirty and uninviting. However I think it were in the winter or spring, it would be beautiful. A great place located in the city to go for a stroll.

A very nice stretch of park in between two downtown streets. Nice play area for kids with a huge stone slide. There was a beer festival going on when we were there and I was so impressed that even with all the food tents and festivities the park was impeccably clean— not even a

Odori Park sits between the Susukino area and JR Sapporo station. In the summer it is an open park with trees, flowers, walkways, sitting areas and a relaxing comfortable atmosphere. I was there for the Snow Festival, so it takes a different look, not just for the snow, but
Odori park is beautiful during Sapporo snow festival, hundreds of snow sculptures, nice shows, hot drinks, local food and thousands of tourists! You can enjoy tere!
We only arrived Sapporo on the last nite of this festival . Thought it woud be a big festival but not really . It has numerous smal stalls for food which is good.
very nice place in Sapporo.near to Tanuki koji,susukino,Sapporo station When you are in Sapporo must visit this place

Well the O-dori park comes into its own during the Sapporo’s Snow Festival. The exhibits are fantastic. Lots of food and souvenir shops. The ice skating was fun. Watching the ski and snowboard jumps and other performances were great. Crowd control was excellent with one way
Beautiful park turned into a winter wonderland with a German winter market serving up great food and a wide array of merchandise!
Great for a great walk, 11 blocks of fun in the center of the city, beer gardens in summer, varied cuisines, for all pockets

We were in Sapporo in Sept. 2018, just in time to celebrate the Sapporo Autumn Fest in Odori Park. Plenty of BBQ food stores, various types of beer from Japan & Germany, fresh seafood like oysters, prawns, fishes etc. Truly enjoyable festival spread over 3 weeks in September.

This is a long stretch in the midst of buildings and roads with the clock tower and the old government office at opposite ends. It was a little bleak when we were there since they were closing up areas to start building the snow sculptures for the Snow Festival happening in a
Nice to go for work , you can see TV clock tower . It is beautiful. Always have activity/event at this place.

Visited in November and the area feels like a little Christmas village. Stalls are in the area selling various items from different country themes. We love love loved the dutch and german food stalls!!!

We we're there after the light illumination (bad timing) cause by the fotos I saw at Xmas it look so pretty (now they're actually getting mountains of snow ready for the ice sculpture in February to march (just so so they get harden by the weather in the next 2monthes turning
I can keep on walking and watching people nonstop at this park. The beautiful lights in the evening makes the place so lively.
We were in Sapporo in mid December. We visited the christmas market which felt especially special in the snow. The lights at night were beautiful.
A lovely area to walk around - Christmas market, lights, good eateries... just a stroll around in the cold winter can be so satisfying!!!

The park was beaurifully lighted up... just like what we saw from the internet. It was blistering cold but the kids love playing in the snow blizzard.Our winter clothes were covered with snow.. There were many stalls selling souveniers & hot drinks.. lovely place.

We went through Odori Park several times whilst we were staying in Sapporo for Christmas. We made one particular trip where we spent time looking at the markets/lights/taking photos. It was nice, food very overprice but expected at the Christmas markets. Where we have had

Went there in the winter and omg it feels so much like winter wonderland. It is so pretty!! The lights, the christmas market. It's just so amazing, so beautiful. It is also crowded but the lights are just so pretty at night. The ambience is really nice.

If you are into major festivals, the best time to visit Odori Park is definitely in the winter months. However, if all you want is a relaxing stroll in the park, autumn isn't a bad time to visit at all. The fall color is all around, and the weather isn't too cold in Oct.
We were hoping for more light structures. What they had were impressive, but just a few thou. Festive atmosphere and loved the German style Christmas market.
Stopped by Sapporo Odoriferous Park for White Illumination light up. The reading tower was lighted up together with other colourful light structures in the park.

A well located and well looked after park in the middle of the town near the biggest subway station. Surrounded by shopping options and the famous TV tower and the clock tower. Christmas market and lighting were just great; with kids and camera one can spend a lot of time in

Nice spot for photos at night, especially with the Sapporo TV tower framing the night scene. There is a vendor who takes photos for free and if you want to bring home a nicely printed photo, that will cost 1,200 yen.
We were there before Christmas and the whole stretch of the park is adorned with Christmas lighting. It was so lovely and beautiful! The German corner has the best churros and chocolate!

Nice place to relax. Park is not huge but divide in a few parts. I went in December and there is a Christmas Market near the Sapporo Tower section. Illuminations light make the park look great during nite time. A must visit place when u r in Sapporo
Visited the park during both during day and night time. Recommended to go there at both time just for the experience. The light sculptures are exciting to look at during night time.
Now the park was decorated with Christmas lighting. Full of tourists during weekends. Also got stalls selling foods and Christmas decorating items.

Odori park stretches out from Sapporo TV tower to the other side of the city. Take a stroll with your other half here towards the tv tower. If youre lucky there will be activities or light shows in the park during yiur visit.
Initially I thought that the park was large but it was actually quite small. The Sapporo tower is located at the end of the park and they have started to set up the winter ornaments.

Odori park was set with illuminatio ready for winter season. Since Nov. 25, the Park setup Christmas Festival for the public which offers photo service, illumination for photo ops, food/beverages stalls perfect for winter season (Hot wine was intensely perfect! Small shops offer

It is located in the heart of the city and this makes it a good place to hangout from your shopping or other sightseeing tour. Just take a stroll around this really long park on any season and there is something to see everytime. The Sapporo Tower is on 1 end and the old high
It could be a little chilly in the end of October, but bundle up and stroll with locals. Beautiful flowers adding to the view

Beautiful park but this place was under reno on a Saturday morning. I guess it is in anticipation of putting up the Xmas lightings. Some maple trees were still yellow and this gives the place a distinctive colour. Overall, i ll rate this place a 4 star instead of 5.
Walk passed this park when on my way to Daimaru Pokémon center. Beautiful place. U can’t missed this place, it’s at the heart of Sapporo !
An open space with greenery and building surrounding. The tower is nice. The weather is great. It will be good to visit it again.
Most visitors will pass this location anyway. We came during off-season and there was a lot of construction during early November.
Our kids love to run and chase the bird here. And also love to see the fountain and observe the flowers

This is a very nice park and worth a nice stroll through the beautifully landscaped park. The space saving parking facility we found next to the park was interesting. Your car is put on a lift and then moved up/down.
Took some pictures at Odori Park but no event this time.. Wend underground to Pole Town up to Susukino Station

Make sure that you see the Black Slide sculpture by Isamu Noguchi. It's great when a work of art is also a toy. Watch the kids and their parents having fun. Lucky for me, I was in Sapporo in time for the Odori Park Food Festival. Even not speaking Japanese, I could point and

This is a well-maintained Park in the centre of Sapporo. The flowers were blooming and there were plenty of people hanging out. There’s an observation deck where you can see the whole city too. It’s worth visiting if you want somewhere to relax in the centre of the city.
We were crazy lucky to be there during the Obon Festival and Odori Park was beautiful! The gorgeous Kimonos, the food, the music, the dancing: all just amazing.

This is a block-wide and many-blocks-long grassed area with flower beds and pedestrian paths. Very cute in the middle of a city but it really isn't what I'd call a park, more like an oversized elongated garden.
Nice place to have a leisurely walk...it seems to link a lot of the key attractions in the area too...

There was a autumn festival going on for the month of Sept. Lots of nice food from around 12pm - 8pm. The park has nice flowers and it feels nice just sitting around. It’s near the Sapporo TV tower and the exit facing the tower is where you can take the bus to Sapporo factory or

Sapporo is Japan's fifth largest city, with a population of just under 2 million. Odori Park is like New York's Central Park. It's a long park, in the centre of the city. Apart from the space, it's a great a venue to host festivals. such as Sapporo's Autumn Festival, a great

Lovely flowers grown in the park, many locals and tourists seem to enjoy taking photos with them, including myself. People were sitting in the grass, family came with kids running around, elderly people strolling.. just chilling on a public holiday when I visited. There's some

Odori park is lovely and great for those who love photography! There are many interesting art statues around the park, seasonal flowers and a cool water fountain. Beautiful open area to relax and take a break from the other buzzing areas of the city. You can also find local food
It’s a nice place to walk and chill, in most part of the year they have different “fest” now it’s the autumn fest. You can eat and try food of Sapporo & Hokkaido.

The Odori Park stretches across about over 3 blocks. Covered with verdant grass splashed with bursts of vividly coloured flowers. Water fountains add to the calming ambiance. When not the center of activity (e.g. marathons, bazaar), it is a quiet place where one can just sit on

Capped with the Sapporo TV Tower, this great central park offers a great place to walk, play with the family, or enjoy a festival. While I was there, there was a ramen festival and an international food festival. What fun!
Very pleasant to walk downtown in this park. Fountains and seats. Of course you need luck for the weather...

This place is pretty busy in the summer, whereby people loiter or resting around the lawn. It’s quite a big open park separated by 2 main road and each part has their own water fountains. You can have a wonderful full uninterrupted view of the famed Sapporo Television Tower from

Park has many activities , from the Sapporo beer garden festival , which we missed unfortunately. To the dance and cultural festival . Nice place to stroll , culminating in the Tv tower. Some peddle street food. Do it is good for kids and adults . This park is free by the way,

When we took a subway to visit Sapporo Beer Museum, we saw a sign saying, "Beer tastes good in the Eighth Block." The sign was put up by the Sapporo Brewery, but we couldn't catch what it meant even after visiting the museum and the beer garden attached to the museum (or the
Park is behind Sapporo TV Tower. Beautiful flowers and pine trees all around. In August there are many festivals held. Good place to walk. Many benches around to just sit and relax.

Lots of beautiful flower beds & arrangements in Odori Park in June. Cool weather. Tasty & reasonably priced food in the park. There are several stalls selling products of sapporo. Relaxing area. On a parallel street is a shopping area for food products, cosmetics & dry

For those visiting Saporro in winter, the Ice Sculptures Exhibition at Odori Park is a must visit place. There are numerous sculptures to see. After this one can take a panoramic view of the city from the Saporro TV observatory.
best place to visit in the afternoon. Garden is great. You can chill out at night at the park's beer garden set up.
A very pleasant walk that can last a few hours strolling, sitting, taking in central Sapporo. Have a drink, stroll some more. Enjoyable
We went there couple times, and wished we had more time to hang out there. .nice place for families to hang out.
It's really nice to be there during summer. Sit on the grass and have a nice picnic while enjoying the sunshine and breeze. Nice!

went to sapporo when the cherry blossom was in the earlier stage...i notice this park was one of the place in sapporo where the cherry blossom fully bloom quite late during the season. But lucky enough got few cherry trees already got bloom when we were there No restriction

This place is easily accessible by subway. There is also landmark standing here which is sapporo tv tower. The garden is properly maintained make it very pleasant to be here. They have tourist centre nearby if you need info/help. But language is a bit difficult. Shopping mall

My family and I walked Odori Park last Wednesday and I thought it was a beautiful place to be. There were several park benches for the seniors to sit on, there was a water feature where the kids could get their feet wet and lots of beautiful flowers for all to see. There are

From one end of the park with the Sapporo TV Tower to the other end with the beautiful Rose gardens, the park is full of activities and exhibits during the summer months. We were here in July. There were Beer gardens with food, tables and tents, set up. There was further down a

A very pleasant place to stroll and relax. During our visit various beer brands were preparing tents for their annual beer event. One block of the Park for Suntory, another for Sapporo, the next for Kirin, etc. We were told the tents still needed due to cold weather at night .

Was very happy to be there during the snow festival. To take in the atmosphere with everybody else around me for the food galore, ice sculptures, thick snow, cold, etc.. it’s different from where I come from, once in a lifetime to experience snow in a city full of culture.

Its central location in the city centre makes it a convenient stopover for a rest, to chill or to visit. At one end is the Sapporo Tower and observatory. When we visited, preparations were being made for a beer festival.

I might be visiting on the wrong date as the flower exhibition just ended but the beer festival not yet started. It was raining full 7 days during my visits and not much flower to be seen. Weather however was good to have a rest or stroll along the park.
The park is very near to the Sapporo JR station. The writer took about 6 minutes of walk to there where had many department stores nearby.

There is a rose garden dedicated to Sapporo's sister city in the United States-Portland Oregon. Take time to sit down, admire the flowers and the wonderful people. Various statues and fountains are scattered throughout this aesthetically designed park.

This open area in the middle of Sapporo is very well-maintained. The flower beds and lack of trash make it a very pleasant place to stroll or just sit. You see a mish-mash of tourists, locals and schoolkids on any given day. It's a very calm oasis in the middle of big city.

Went there in the last day of Lilac Festival and disappoint since it was done a day before. But there are still some stalls and since it was pouring rain the whole day, we have to 'splash' our way around. The park is long and divided by several red lights. A good place to unwind

Lovely park in the middle of Sapporo. It goes through est to west of town, surrounded by the very modern skyscrapers and the TV tower. During winter is used for the snow festival. It is a must if you are in Sapporo
Flowers blooming and festivals held there. Good for a walk and we enjoy watching Japanese kids playing around. Very nice place.

Odori park is anice place to take a stroll just to look at the surroundings. Went on a good day with nice weather and clear blue sky. This place is just a stone throw away from susukino area and sapporo station.

Odori Park stretches several blocks and is the heart of the city. Many festivals and events are held there each year, the most famous being the snow festival in February. At one end is the TV tower which you can pay ~720yen (adult) to go to the top for those amazing Instagram

This park took up about 10 blocks of space in the middle of the city. It's a great space to spend some time on a beautiful day. There are several monuments and water fountains scattered around the park. A very relaxing space in a big city and a good place to take photos with the

Nice botanical respite in the city. Huge area with beautiful flowers. It's a great place to people watch. We only went through Odori Park as were were getting from one location to another. Unless there is something going on or you like to just visit a nice park, it isn't a

Very nice green belt in the city with unique child play features. We arrived just after wisteria? festival in may. There was large wine and food expo the week after. No idea if that is year round of temp.

odori park starts from 2 choume and finish　　10 choume. There is a park created by Isamu Noguchi. Kids always enjoy his artistic slides. Corn barbecue is delicious. You should try. Flower garden is well mentenanced.

It happens that the lilac festival was held in Odori Park when we visited it. Other than the general greens and colourful flowers, some sections of the park were full of food stalls. Ramen shops from Hokkaido, wines from loacl wineries and international food stalls were there

our cruise ship docked in otaru. we decided to first catch the train to sapporo. we were able to just walk around and enjoy several sights like the clock tower, tv tower, and beautiful odori park. we also visited the former government bldg. which had beautiful landscaped flowers
Good for people watching and relaxing. Lots of benches to sit down and meditate if you choose. Clean.
Went twice. Once when raining and second when sunny. So much more life and fun under the sun. Easy to access if you are walking down the area, accessible by underpass from train stations.
Good place to relax... fountains, flowers and amazing view on all angles. The children had a good time here.
Lovely Park and flowers were in full bloom. Lilac flowers were in full bloom too! Lots of benches to sit and enjoy beautiful environment!
From the TV tower the park looked very nice but when we walked through it we saw the grass wasn’t looking very good and the whole park needed some more maintenance. It was not what we expected.

I expected to see a lot more lilacs at the park but I saw more tulips of all shades and colors on display. I guess if you care to look around lilacs purplish, pinkish, and whites are certainly in bloom on trees across the park. Not that I was disappointed especially with all the

Like most Japanese cities, Sapporo has more than too many drab buildings. What we found separated Sapporo from the other big cities of Japan was Odori Park. Several festivals were being held while we were there. These attracted a number of people, including families with small

I was expecting the park to be decked with lilacs for the festival. I guess I was wrong. There were more tulips on display than lilacs although they were certaily there purplish, pinkish and white flowerd blooming on the trees that lined the park. I have to say that I amazed to
The clock tower gives you a great view of the city & surrounding mountains. Very close to the metro line as well.
This park stretches almost 2 km in downtown Sapporo. From the TV tower you have a splending view over the entire park. Specially nice during cherie blossom time.
The heart of Sapporo is full of flowers, sculptures and people relaxing. As the sun sets, there are great views of the TV Tower.

Despite the rain we thoroughly enjoyed a stroll in the park with its various booths that are set up for the lilac festival. It's very refreshing to emerge from the underground mall and have a wander through the gardens. We especially loved the tulip beds that were in full bloom.
Is a park with beautiful flowers and statues. We did not walk further up to explore more. Next to it is TV tower.

When we were there a group of elder citizens were planting up the flower beds, which later came in to bloom, beautiful and colourful. There is very little litter in the park despite there being few litter bins. The people of Sapporo take their rubbish home with them. More
Not worth a visit, but good to walk through when catching the metro to other places. Well maintained garden and lawns.

This is a very pleasant park in the middle of Sapporo. There is a fountain and a wonderful little playground with a large white slide and a spectacular Noguchi Isamu black slide. It’s hard not to miss walking through the park as you explore Sapporo but I would actually go spend
A park that says it all, nature, view, art and culture, what more can you ask for. We enjoyed munching our fresh fruits to celebrate spring time in Sapporo!

Located at a walking distance from our hotel it was a central location. You can walk the park over ground or go underground and you'll discover shops and subway stations all the way to Sapporo JR station. Practical when it is cold or rainy. The park is lovely and since we
We enjoyed walking on this park, though the garden were not yet in bloom because of the winter season but still a park that you don’t want to miss if you visit Sapporo.

I love Sapporo! More like a New York City, The main bus and train station,Taxi in same area,and Sapporo tower is only 10 min walk from station!..and so many restaurants shopping area,you choose ground level or under Town. The public Bathroom are clean ,Forget the weather .In
This is a must visit if you happen to be in sapporo. I was here in Winter so there was a nice Christmas market filled with good food and gifts.

OK so it was just after winter and heavy snow. Still a great strip to hang out on in the middle of the city. Lots of open spaces, benches, views of the TV tower which is nice at night. It's just a park of course, not Disneyland, but if you're staying nearby, go for a
very nice park in downtown Sapporo a good place to spend 2 - 3 hour at the time we were there they had Oktobefest going on at the mini tokyo tower with lots of people and beer it was really cool

This park is in the center of Sapporo. During the snow festival, ice sculpture are displayed here. There are flowers in the summer months. Toilet facility is available in the park. Clock Tower and JR Tower are within walking distance.
If you are near to the park, you are near to everywhere. It is situated at the centre. You will walk past it every time you go out.

We visited here in February for the snow festival. It was a great location for the event and lovely to walk around to view the exhibits. The ground was covered in snow and we had snow falling on us as we navigated our way through each of the snow sculptures. We also went up the
If you like heavy snow, you must visit this place at winter, because it's so beautiful. Sometimes some kids also playing snow in front of the Sapporo Landmark

I visited in March and it was still snowing. Nevertheless the snow has made this whole park even more surreal and peaceful to the eye. Nice place to hang out and walk around in the snow soaking in the city life and energy
Lovely park during winter that is full of exhibits for the ice festival. Its buzzing with loads of atmosphere but can be COLD so dive in to one of the free warming booths
This park is so close to the station and it has a very beautiful scenery. A must visit park when in Sapporo.

It would better to say that it is a large food court rather than leisure park during my visit. September every year, there is a gourmet festival in the park. Local and overeseas tourists like me are flooding everywhere of the park. We can find your favorite food from over a

Odori Park sits right in the centre of Sapporo. During the day, it's a stunning green space that breathes life into the city. At night it is lit up with glowing fountains and lines up with the Mt Okura Ski Jump in the distance. It's extremely clean and well cared for. We found

Our visit to Sapporo was planned for festival time and the park was a hive of activity. The carvings were stunning and the food stalls were buzzing, but we sought food elsewhere as it was so cold. The park must be visited during both day and night, as during the night the
Visited Odori Park during the Flower Festival and it was just so beautiful. It was summer but summers in Hokkaido being quite mild, it was pleasant as it was not too hot.
Only able to take a photo of this tower from far due to close for winter renovation. Best to visit during spring, where the flowers bloom :)
i came here when winter. so everything is covered with snow. its a winter wonderland. very beautiful place.

Since it is the opening for the Sapporo Snow Festival, we really do enjoy it. So many food stalls and displays. We went, during the day and at night. We enjoyed the food during the day. At night they have some programs/activities like a mini concert of the Japanese singers
The Odori park are full with white snow and make the park look so beautiful and good place for kids to play the snow games there.

Not much to see I know we just missed the winter festival but I still thought for a famous park there would be a few vendors for food or drinks or anything but nothing my partner and I walked a few blocks of it then turned back

We walked the whole length of the park from the Sapporo Tower to the former Judicial Court. It was after the Snow Festival so the ice sculptures were mostly dismantled but the ground was still covered in snow. I would like to visit it again in the summer.
Was here two weeks ago when there was snow festival. This time around was still cold but no snow fest. There is always some kind of activities. Fun place to be.
Wonderful event! Spent hours viewing the snow sculpture. Visited the Sapporo TV Tower as well. Do expect a large crowd and tourists. Worth the visit!
A very nice park to visit regardless of the season. A huge park that you will really appreciate the size and the upkeep to keep the park nice. A nice center for Sapporo and Suzukino area.

I loved my visit to Odori park and would gladly go again, however I ended up going during the snow festival where I saw so many magnificent sculptures and a lively crowd of people. Well worth a visit would definitely recommend! Only downside was that be ready for the large
I might be being biased, but I loved the park. However it was during the winter festival, not the summer. The festival was amazing. Lots to see, eat and drink.
Main area for the snow festival. Lots of amazing ice sculptures, souvenir shops and food choices. It is well organized and totally fun experience
Visited the park during snow festival. Well worth a visit. Lots of people. Lots of foods and lots of huge snow sculptures.

Always something going on here. To date I have visited in summer (late July) and a beer fest was ongoing and in February when the snow festival is what's happening. The underground passageways under the park are clutch when the weather is too hot and too cold. Park has nice

Definitely dress warm for this one...and take along decent boots or shoes for walking through snow/ice. Also recommend breaking up your visit by popping into a coffee shop or bar to warm up and then seeing the park again in the early evening.
We were there for snow gestival and thought the park was a perfect location to showcase the exhibit. Very clean and nicely situated in the city.
Was there last year December during their white illumination. Beautiful place at night to go with friends, couples and even young kids.
Visited the park for the snow festival. Great ice sculptures, good food and an awesome experience. Dress warm and the hot hands came in handy.

A must do by day and night ! The snow and ice sculptures are fantastic. By night you have a light show with some of the sculptures and by day you can see the details on them. Lots of food stands and Sapporo specialties.

Perfect for those who’re interested in festive moods. There are many ice carvings and sculptures for those who love to take pictures. You will also find performances like choir, bands and snow sports. As with most festivals, there are also plenty of food stalls to indulge in. As
This is an annual event with many snow sculptures make magic in the snow. The event lasts one week and is very crowded. I came two days early to watch the artists do their thing.
We visited the park in October 2017. The autumn foliage was simply beautiful. It is great place to take photos.

when i visit this place this january there's not a lot of thing i can inform but i got information thre's will be a ice carnival in this february and the carnival was the number 3 top ice carving carnival in the world so you better to come during the carnival the carnival will

Unfortunately, we came to Sapporo on the wrong dates and ended up missing the ice festival, which usually happens during the first week of February. Odori park is usually the host to this amazing event.
Visited this place during winter and my kids enjoyed playing in the snow. Missed the festival where ice sculptures are displayed. Heard it typically happens in February to March.
10 mins walk from Sapporo stn.. It didnt look as nice as it should probably in the day.. it was all dark when i visited in the evening.. should consider visiting in the daytime..
The winter illumination is beautiful. Would love to come back and see the Sapporo Winter Festival ice sculptures!

We were here to enjoy the white illumination for the winter and to visit the german market. A fair bit of crowd during the X'mas period and the area as very slippery. Different colours of lighting along the stretch of the park and german market is near the clock tower. I guess
Terrible, i cant believe they call it a park espec ially when theres nothing there in the park... we went during winter
Well lit in the night during the winter. A good location for beautiful photos. Worth the visit. Long line of colorful lights in different shapes.

A long stretch of park in Sapporo city.. the popular area Is near the JR tower. Went during the Snow White illumination and there is the German food fare on going. The lights display is nice and it stretched along the whole park good to walk especially after meal.

The park has Christmas lightings all around. There is a Christmas market closer the the clock tower. It is like a small german market. Did not find anything very local there. They have stuff imported from overseas. I prefer if they have more local stuff.
We had the great pleasure of visiting Odori Park during Christmas and the park was illuminated from one end to the other it was fantastic with all the snow. I’m sure it’s beautiful in summer as well.
Its a White Christmas! Should go before the 25 of December so that you can experience the Christmas bazar! Nice lights at night! Hope to be back next year!

It was nice there, especially when it was snowing. During the night, there are Christmas lights that illuminate the surroundings, making it into more spectacular. There are also a few small stores across the road that sell some food. Their sausage is lit af
My family went during winter, park is nice especially during the evening time when lights are up. Park is walking distance to Susukino, Nijo market and Tanukikoji shopping arcade.

We went there in mid dec so the illumination was up....the lights were nice but we kinda feel it’s a bit overrated as the park itself wasn’t so big. We got lots of nice shots there tho. Snows made the experience more romantic with nicely lit illumination background. All in
Very pretty lit up areas at night. Market had gluwein and frankfurters and many other things for sale.....but, most impressive were the lights. See pics.

First experience - awed by the bright colorful lights at night; range of innovative ways the foods’ vendors display their product (can’t comment on the taste though; as not sure if the foods are halal).
Wonderful Christmas Carnival happening at Odori Park. Enjoyed the carnival for 2 nights. Beautiful illumination in the winter.

I went to the park to check out the illumination and I liked what I saw. Very Christmasy. Everything was so beautiful and there was a Christmas market near the tower. I got there quite late when everything was closing.
Nothing fantastic during the day . Should explore in the evening with the lightings and snow. Near the shopping area

The park is beautiful with the lights at the evening but they shut down the light by 10pm. There is a christmas bazaar market also where you can get some snacks or stuffs. A must visit while in sapporo as it is near to the sapporo station
Got the illumination light event. Very beautiful good for photo shoot. Is cold and snow got Christmas atmosphere

It was such a beauty of lights. It is offered Nov to Dec. It opens at 5:00 pm. You will be offered for a free picture taking by professionals and you can have the option to buy the larger picture with frames. Its a great way to have a momento of your Sapporo trip.

There is Christmas illumination going on now. Very nice considering the entire park is covered in snow. Tip is to make sure you have on snow boots as it gets slippery. The Christmas fair is on the clock tower side of the park.

Ordinary park in the city centre, nice place to walk off a meal. On the eastern end is the Sapporo TV tower, one of the few landmarks in the city. It was alright - I certainly wasn't awestruck both by the tower and the park.
White illumination is very beautiful. It make my kids hysteris 😁. Sooo awesome! Butttt very cold. We make a snow man here... u also can play with snoe

The place was well decorated for visitors to soak in the Christmas atmosphere. The Park stretches over several streets but the key activities are near the TV Tower areas where there is the Christmas Market with merchandise from different parts of Europe (Norway, Russia, Germany,
During winter time, the park has light show and a small christmas fair. Its really enjoyable to visit the park in the evening.

We visited when the place was almost enchanting with the light Illumination. There was also a Christmas market with warm food and gifts from all over the world. By just walking the entire O-dori Park, you are sure getting ready for Christmas! Don’t miss it if you’re in the area.
The snow scene at Odori park was beautiful! With the clock tower at the background, It was just stunning!

You need to come here at night. They have a mini xmas market. Plenty of souvenirs and food to choose from. They have light illuminated during this time. They even have a santa claus walking around. Marvellous!!!!

It was snowing when we were there, so there's not much park to speak of. There is a nightly light up which reminds me a little of Murmansk which we visited last year. But it's not much compared with Singapore's Orchard Rd lights.
We always pass by this park in going to Odori. It is filled with Christmas decorations and brightly lighted at nights. There were stalls everywhere.
Very beautiful decoration lights, Christmas events , snowy and chilled. Enjoy walking street, night market festival.
Beautiful park in the middle of Sapporo with lots of open spaces. What made it even more beautiful was the winter illumination that was decorating it all along.

Right smack in the middle between two busy roads is this oasis called Odori park. Home to Sapporo TV Tower and the annual Germany Christmas Market, this is a place that is impossible to miss. Came in winter, the park is at a freezing point at night. Purchase a baked sweet
So pretty during the winter time. Beautiful light displays and very festive. Must visit during the winter especially when it snows.

The Odori park white illumination is really beautiful, there's also Christmas market with shops selling goods and food too. Remember to wear a pair of anti slip boots and wear warmly as is quite cold outdoor.
U don't have to purposely make a trip here coz u will passed by this park quite often as it is just located at the heart of the city.

Came here in summer. Flowers and fountain. Great hang out spot both for night and day. Not crowded at all. There are food stalls but the environment remained clean. Surrounded by the Odori Station entries and exits. Shops nearby. Close to tanukikoji shopping arcade. There is

We visited yesterday morning and it looks as though preparations are underway for the next festival in the park. Lovely park to stroll around with some beautiful trees but the autumn colour is making way for soon to be snow covered trees. Easy to get to and worth a visit. Also a

Ive had the chance to see odori park at many different time of the year. Always something happening, between beer festival, snow sculpture contest, international food festival etc... Enjoy sunny days in summer, and fall colour with all the trees around. Many restaurant in the

Visited Odori Park for the second time in this year. The first time I’ve visited was during winter and it looks great with the snow all about. The park is centrally located, just above the Aurora subway station. Sapporo TV tower is also located here so it’s a good idea to visit
A great place to relax and just chill. Take a break from the fast lane and enjoy the view, people and the variety of things happening in the park.

A nice park with awesome night view. There are a lot of shops, stores, restaurants along the park. It's nice to walk during the day. It's even better at night for the great view. It's quite safe and enjoyable to walk in August with some breeze.
It is a landmark in Sapporo. Located in the city centre, Odori Park is a lovely place to visit. Recommended

Odori Park is a very nice, beautiful and quiet park to talk a walk. It has very pretty flowers which really makes the park looks beautiful. The park surrounding is very tranquil and with the various shopping malls nearby, you will not run out of things to do in Sapporo Odori
Gorgeous and lusciously green park situated in the heart of the city. Loved being there! The lights at night are worth a watch too
Odori park is a square within the city. You can easily get there through train (with JR pass). Recommend going there during the day.

Just a park in the city. I think it's better in winter when the snow festival is on. Disappointing for autumn leaves. It's not worth going out of your way to visit but you will pass through at some stage.

When i first got out from Sapporo Station, i was lost trying to locate my hotel! The lady at my hotel explain me the map of the city and she said the map starts from Odori, south and north is divided from there and the city is divided into blocks, Sapporo City Area is not vast

I enjoyed a lovely afternoon here during the Sapporo Autumn Fest. Access is easy. Within walking distance from Sapporo-eki. Just head for the South exit and walk straight all the way. You will pass the former Hokkaido Government Building and the Clock Tower along the way.

This tidy park with occasional sculptures, fountain & playground, is not large enough to have a life of its own It is a pleasant place to stroll through, but it's limited narrow scale doesn't make it anywhere comparable to other large city parks

Just to up date fall in Odori Park, it is nice to take pictures with red leaves now. Always got lot of visitors, a must visit in Sapporo. You may take a slow walk from the TV tower until to the end, it is good and healthy, I enjoy it very much.
Good time to go as the Festival is set up within the park & gives you the chance to try different food.
Small but good feeling Nothing much but very nice ambiance... Was here during Xmas period and can feel it differently with the light and song at the same time. Best moment and good feeling.
We were there during autumn and there were festivals going on. It was really nice to see some local music and dance performances. Interesting experience!
Home to the Snow Festival in February, but, just as nice in the dry cool summer months. Small but centrally located

went there during the park's autumn festival. whole park was full of all sorts of food specialties from all around Hokkaido. they had music and variety shows as well. nice weather to eat outdoors during the night.

A nice park that stretches 12 city blocks in the middle of Sapporo. Seasonal festivals are held here throughout the year. We were here during Summer which is beer festival time. Imagine Oktoberfest spread out for 2 months. Our hotel was right beside it so we spent a lot of time
I came in during Sapporo Autumn food festival so the entire odori park filled with food booth all from Hokkaido best food restaurant. And kids could run around and ppl picnic in the park.
It was a nice festival in fall only, there are food, drink , and lot of things u can join them.

This is nice green space and open area that is lightly popular during the day, clean and well maintained. It is quite pleasant to walk through and enjoy the flowers and sculptures. We visited in early August while the Sapporo Beer festival was still going on, it is the 63rd

We thoroughly enjoyed the park because Autumn Festival was on & there were many many food stalls over 8 blocks of the park and they were all very delicious! The park holds many events throughout the year and has a few beautiful garden beds.

This is a lovely landscaped space in the middle of the city. At the time I was there there were several different festivals going on. But still there was lots of quiet space too. Great place to walk morning noon or night time. And the nighttime view with the tower lights wow!

Lovely park in the heart of the city that runs for many blocks. It's thin and long but often hosts events, beer festivals, dance festivals etc and gives a welcome respite from the roads and tall concrete buildings.

This park is a huge rectangular park that span probably 7 blocks. Its beautiful in summer with colorful flowers, greenery and lot of sitting area. Fountains, seats ,some snacks shops around, a good romantic place for couples and good play area for young kids. Right in the middle

Place was pretty wide and spacious even with the Natsumatsuri (Summer festival) going on. A few sculptures and fountains and many sitting areas. Good place for some greenery in the middle of the city.

Odori Park is centrally located in Sapporo and relaxing to walk through. There are fountains and view of the TV Tower as well as public sculptures by Noguchi. During the summer, several beer festival stands were up and the atmosphere was lively during the day and in the

Had dinner nearby. Decided to chill a little before heading back to hotel. Last time we were here, it was freezing and snowing and we saw nothing. This time - perfect weather, cool (night time) and there were tonnes of people. But not so many that we couldn't find a bench to

Once you heard ~ Park, it should have a park gate, right？in Odori Park, no gate, you can walk in any time you wanted, it is good place for leisure, and also this place will held many festivals in different season, don't miss to visit it while you stay in Sapporo。
The annual summer Beer festival and the snow festival in winter takes place in this big park. Nice park to stroll in

We were expecting a huge park since they have the winter snow festival there. Turn out no more than 2 Football field. We missed the spring blossom and were early for the beer festival. Workers were seen busy putting up tents for the summer beer fest. Timing is important .

The park is located next to our hotel. We walked all the way from end to end and it was such a pleasant and relaxing walk. Flowers were lovely and colourful, thanks to the hard work of the park gardening team. Kudos to them for keeping the garden well kept. The view of the

This is a beautiful park with water fountains and a nice view of the Sapporo TV Tower during the day or evening. Many tourists take photos of the Sapporo sign with the TV Tower in the back drop. There are also many decorative flower beds that you can enjoy and have photo opp
Lots of activities like food booths, plant booths, and beer gardens. It's the center of the city and you can feel the vibe of the local culture.

During Spring starting from end of april, the whole long stretch of the park will be decorated with tulips and surrounded by sakura (cherry blossom trees). In mid June, there is a small scale flower festival. Just like every park in Japan, the cleanliness, facilities (toilet and

A great place for family time. Nice weather with picturesque flower setting made my Japan trip to be a colorful one. The park seems to be a favorite place for local families as well. Love to re-visit again in winter to see different setup.

Not a far walk from Sapporo JR station, and it's adjacent to the Odori station of cos. Quiet and with a fountain in the summer, with grilled corn etc. Good for a chill and a rest, after hefty shopping walks.

There are some flowers and carts selling sweet grilled corn but nothing special if you plan visiting Furano area anyways. This may be great for locals and if you have many days in Sapporo as a relaxing place but other than that I don't see any sense wasting precious tourist time
Visited near sunset times, locals and tourists were gathering near the TV tower and water fountain. Buy beer and enjoy people watching.

We were there on first Sunday of July, and saw 4 different festivals going on: Flower, Jazz, Belgium Beer, and Fair Trade. My guess is that there is always something happening during the weekend. Great fun. Also, watched people jump off the JR Tower on one end, the other end

I visited the park in end May 2017 when the weather was beautiful - blue clear skies and a slightly cool breeze . There was a Ramen festival held on the last weekend in may and the ramen noodle shops we tried was really yummy . The park is quite small compared to Central Park

Its a big nice park to go for a casual stroll & admire the beautiful flowers & surroundings. However, we were lucky there was a big festival on the day we were here. Watched the colourful & interesting performances. There were street food stalls lined along the park as part of
Have place to hand around in this area. Highly recommended to those are first time in Sapporo. Just 5 minutes walk from Sapporo JR station.
Visited in April. Was very cold but no snow. Finally snowed on the last day of our trip and we had a great time.

If you want to ser where the locals go, you must go to Odori Park. You will find families and friends picnicking, couples sitting and enjoying time together, and people taking a break between subway stops. You can have a DIY there, too. We did!
Were were lucky enough to visit when there was a festival on with many food and drink stalls. Our infant son loved the fountain areas and had great fun running around the picnic area.

This is really a collection of parks that starts at the TV tower to the former court of appeals on the other end. In summer, each portion of the Odori park has beautiful flowers. Very nice for photos, people watching, feeding pigeon or just a walk in the park. Lovely.

What can I say - definitely the place to be for the snow festival about 1.5 km worth of snow sculptures, food booths, and entertainment. Each section (block) had different themes - skating and jump rink, Final Fantasy snow sculputure, large ice and snow sculptures, snow
When I was there at the end of May ,I didn't see any intetest thing. Maybe during winter time it will be very intetesting

we visited during early june, lots of beautiful flowers blooming creating a colourful park. it was pretty quiet, not a large park but a good spot for people working at the surrounding buildings to take a break at and wind down. you could also see the sapporo clock tower clearly
Nice cute park in the heart of the city. worth the walk. visited in the end of may and the flowers were beautiful. worth the walk, great for photos
I strolled by the park and found a lot of people chilling in the evening. I can see why - it's filled with flowers and sculptures. Perfect for a break.

A pleasant walk along the park. We went there during Sapporo Autumn Festival and there were many booths and stalls selling foods from various places. This place is also where the famous Sapporo Snow Festival being held.

Located right in the center of the city, Odori Park is a popular park for both locals and tourists. Spring was beautiful with lots of tulips and cherry blossoms. It is a short walk from JR Tower and Susukino. Actually, most of the city attractions are nearby. The old
Every year end there will be a lot of stalls setup selling souvenirs and foods & drinks. A lot of families can be seen playing with snow at this season. The famous clock tower is also located nearby

Odori Park begins at the entrance of Sapporo TV Tower. The park, which runs parallel to a road, consists of plots of grass and small beds of flowers, as well as some fountains and statues. There were some lilacs when I visited on 23 May 2017. I personally did not find Odori Park

In mid-May, theres a Ramen festival where they bring in top 10 shops throughout Japan. Buy a 800 yen ticket & you can choose any stall. Open air concerts. Wine tasting festival. Great visit for a sunny spring day.

Not purposely made a trip to Odori Park. It was so crowded due to Lilac festival, lots of food stalls plus wine events. Walked straight down the park to avoid the crowd, fewer people and enjoy the peacefulness. Really a wonderful afternoon.
