The Fish market was small, compact and well stocked. The prized item was the giant snow crabs. A reasonable portion will set you back £70. Lots of reasonably prized Sushi bars and noodle houses. Really enjoyed a lovely lunch.
Pretty expensive for what you get at the market, was expecting there to be more selection and the prices to be a bit cheaper

Comprises shops selling fresh and dried seafood as well as Japanese snacks and fruits. Nothing is cheap as these are mainly premium foodstuffs. Ate at 1 of the food stalls there. Pictures in the menu showed attractive large portions but the actual bowls when served are

The market was small and not the vibrant, active market that I predicted. A little gloomy feel to be exact. But still I could get the food I wanted to try here. One of the restaurants (Ohiso) seems to be more popular and there was crowd when I left near lunchtime. Good seafood
Conveniently located, short walk from Odori subway. Use exit 34 from the subway. We reached at around 11am on a Thursday morning. Good place for breakfast! The salmon sashimi is OH SO FRESH and YUMZ.
Its quite small but got quite a lot of variations. Love to stroll here just to see the fresh seafoods. Not many parking space here, but you can park nearby and walk to the market for 10 minutes.

I was expecting something like the Tsukiji in Tokyo, but it wasn’t. We walked around trying to find a place for lunch and there was only a few selections. There were fewer shops than expected. We bought some snacks in some shops as the price was pretty reasonable. We ended up

I believe the wholesale market is supposed to be larger but we were short on time in Sapporo and Nijo market wasn’t too far from our hotel. We enjoyed it. We visited on a Tuesday morning around 7:15am and it was pretty empty. Bargain with the vendors. We noticed the vendors on
Nice selection of seafoods. The place closes before 6pm. Good Japanese dining experience. We ate in the place with many people since we are not familiar which restaurant is good.

We decided to check out Nijo Market and see if we could find something for lunch. The seafood stalls were interesting to look at and we found a couple of shops where we purchased something to take home. We didn't see anything we really wanted to eat for lunch so after about
The shop is besides Obihihro Pork Bowl Porco. Really nice and no need queue! Diagonally opposite the fish market! Amazing Kaisendon (Sashimi Rice Bowl)!
Awesome place to buy and taste the fresh seafood... Little eateries can grill, cook your purchase for lunch. Rice bowls of all the different varieties of seafood toppings. 👍

Went to Nijo Market for a late afternoon lunch. Went around to see tt prices were very steep. But looking at the picture we thought it was worth it as the bowl was full. Went in to a shop nnthe first thing she asked at the table was small or large when we hve not even ordered
Went here several years ago and this time we only spend half an hour there. Mainly caters for tourists now. Easy walk from the Ibis Styles hotel.
Cure your seafood crave and everything sea related here! Its a seafood market with no seafood smell at all! highly recommended !

Great place for seafood as everything is located together. However, I would definitely say it has become slightly touristy and over hyped. Regardless, I had a wonderful meal whilst I was there and I felt the prices were affordable. It’s convenient to get to. About a 10 minute

Went there a couple of different time to eat sashimi rice bowls. There are many seafood stores and restaurants. Restaurants are very small. They understand english and have english menus. The quality of seafood is superb, but the price is also on the high-end.

Hokkaido is world renown for its fresh seafood, crabs, scallops, shrimp and much more. This fish market serves as the wholesale and retail center of Sapporo and a visit in the morning will see beautiful displays of all the fish. If you walk down from the TV tower perpendicular
Came here in the early morning and dug into some fresh tuna and salmon. It was really tough to resist the king crab! Some places could get crowded, but you'll find a table for sure.

The size of the market is not that big. Shops are well arranged. Seafood is fresh. I recommend having the king crabs and oysters. There are restaurants within the market. I think this place is best to be visited in the morning.

This place is a must if you want to eat fresh seafood specially crabs! They serve king crabs and hairy crab. For me the hairy crab taste better than the king crab. They also serve fresh oysters, scallops and sea urchins. You can also buy fresh fruits in this place.
Went here in cold December, it is small and cramped and very cosy. We loved the fish bowl (Donburi) they offered here and had a nice time looking at all the different stalls.

Such a cute market place to rush to for breakfast... seafood is so fresh ... had a very satisfying breakfast. A bit pricey but well worth the freshness in the morning. Definitely a must-go for all to savour good Japanese seafood breakfast.

First... avoid crab and uni... these appears to have the highest mark ups. Instead, we ordered oysters, scallops and Tuna belly... which though at a premium, still represent very good value compared to back home and is super fresh.

The market is pretty small. Just a small area. Had our kaisendon breakfast there. It's not cheap. Pretty pricey. It is easy to walk around as it is small. We tried the melon and it's good! Better than the one we had in Hakodate. The grape on the other hand, it doesn't taste as
We had our lunch here and food r a bit pricey but fresh seafood is all about it. There r some many stalls and you have to decide. Small compare to Tsujiki Market. A must visit when u r in Sapporo
It is a market that are selling king crab and other seafood. They can speak a little english. You can have the seafood cook on the restaurant.

It is an interesting market to visit. Not like tsukiji fish market which is large. This is small. The shops are only at one side of the road but there are lots of fresh seafood that you can get. The sushi shops there are one of the freshest in town. Overall, nothing

If you are expecting the like of Tsukiji Market, then you will be disappointed. Nijo Markewt is just a small fish market as compare to her famous cousin. But it is worth your time and visit. I personally like its nice, pleasant, clean setup. Here is where I have my wonderful

They say it's a must go..and since you have come all the way to Sapporo, yes it's a must go But don't expect Tokyo's tsujiki market.... Nijo market is relatively small but you can see all the local seafood on sell here especially the famous large crabs and dried scallops (none
Chose this stall in the market. Cleaned clam and scallops for sashimi. They put it together and I sat at the table inside. Ponzu, wasabi and shoyu was provided. Excellent and super fresh.

Nijo fish market is a small market place, unlike any wet market, there most selling fish, especially those fished in Hokkaido area, like crabs, scallop and sea urchin. Don’t compare with the Japanese famous fish market like Tsukiji in Tokyo. There is only one row of shops

We woke up too late for breakfast and too early for lunch, so we decided to go to Nijo market for brunch! We chosed a stall that had fresh seafood for you to choose from. We freshly picked each one of them and enjoyed the seafood as they were cooked for us. We had 1 oyster, 2

My family and I went to visit the Nijo Market on July 14th and I was a bit surprised by the amount of people that were there at 8:30am. We looked around the market and tried to find a place to eat breakfast. I also bought a couple of bags of dried scallops to bring back to

There is another fish market in Sapporo but decided to head down to Nijo Market first when we reach the city. This is a very small setup market where you will be able to find seafood eatery as well as the dried food here but compare to Hakodate the dried food is a little more

We were spoiled by all that Tsukiji Market had to offer in Tokyo. So, these smaller "fish markets" in other cities don't impress. Obviously they have fresh fish (more crab here), but we found better deals on hunks of sashimi at the underground supermarket in Susukino. So, we
There are some fresh sea food. Dried sea food are abundant. If you pass by stop by. You don’t have to go out of your way to visit here.

As my husband is involved in the Fishing Industy we always seek out the Fish and Local markets wherever we travel. Nijo Market was a very good example of a local market. Always interesting to see the many varieties of local products available and on sale. Many of the stalls had

Went to Nijo Market with my family about 2 weeks ago. Convenient as the Tanuki Koji Shopping Arcade is just across the road. Susukino and Odori Park are also within walking distance of 15 - 20min. Love the fresh seafood, though the variety may not be as comprehensive as Hakodate
this town is with lots of seafood restaurants … for tourist and locals; it seems local buying lots of seafood from here …

Good place for sushi and seafood , very fresh , Particular one stall name OHISO . Bear in mind must take Q number cause its very popular . After your meals the owner will give one famous Hokkaido ice-cream . Yummy .
A small market, mainly frequent by tourists. Suggest to go to the central market where more stores and cheaper.

If you are into seafood, this is the place! We always go to seafood markets when in Japan and we did not miss this one either. Had some really fresh, delicious, huge BBQ scallops cooked right in front of us for Y500 each. Worth every yen and a must try!

Opens in the morning till late afternoon. Suggest to go early to catch a glimpse of their operations. The dried scallops are beautiful but sure to bargain with the shops for a better price. They also sells fresh seafood for dining in. I didn’t stay Long as I can’t stand the
Had some of the freshest seafood here!! Found a nice little shop which sells really fresh seafood! Lucky find!

It’s near the city center and if you have time left it’s nice to visit this market. Within half an hour you’ve seen it all but nice to see the huge crabs and other fishes. The shops are al more or less the same.

What a great place to see all of the local fish and seafood. Several offered samples of dried or smoked fish. We ate at one of the shops recommended by our tour guide. The grilled crab legs were amazing. Needless to say we left the restaurant stuffed!
I wanted to see this one but we got there at closing. They still had some huge crab on display. An interesting place to see if you have at least 30mns to spare and go during the day.

If you want to try the famous Hokkaido snowcrab or King crab this is the market to visit. They also serve huge scallop, tasty uni and oysters. The snow crab and King crab are not cheap, if you are going for the live one but its worth a try... they are just yummy!!!

It was to our surprise, we went on a weekday at lunch hours during the Easter holiday, there were only a few people, not even much tourist. We walked around some shops, brought some dried scallops and strawberry basically most of the shops put their prices up high and when u

Come here if you are a fan of chirashi bowl and seafood. They have a variety of stalls selling fresh seafood as well as dry scallops for you to buy back as gifts. Stop by one of the shop for lunch and remember to take pictures as memory.

We stayed for three nights at an AirBnB apartment just next to Nijo Market. Stalls are mostly selling fresh seafood and there were also some restaurants, pubs and cafes around the area. Prices at the market were generally a bit higher as can be expected for a place catering to
They are not for citizen: only expensive stuff they carry. Crab, Yubari melon, processed foods, etc.

It’s a fish market around two blocks. There are shops selling both fresh and dry seafood, and seafood restaurant: sashimi rice bowl, grill sea urchins and clams, all kinds cooking of crabs which Sapporo is famous for. Sashimi scallop is extraordinary fresh which you can’t

Costly but totally worth it, coz it was super sweet n super fresh. Would recommend to go for the live crabs rather than the frozen or “dead” ones that are displayed, worth every bit you spend. Sea urchin was above expectation, no fishy “urine” smell

From our Nest hotel, it was a 10 minutes is need to walk around the market if you were did not stopping to look at things. We had a 2 person seafood meal which include 3 different kinds of crabs - hairy crab, snow crab and king crab, sea urchin, salmon roe, yellow roe and 4 raw
Enjoyed my time walking around here. If you like seafood this is the place. I thought prices were reasonable for fresh seafood. Fresh fruits available also. I will go back when I visit Sapporo again.

There are many shops selling a wide range of products, though many sell seafood. You can buy grilled oysters or sea urchins directly from the shops selling the produce. There are little restaurants selling seafood items like king crab bowls and sashimi.

You can expect costs to be higher since this is a market for tourist, no doubt it's still fresh for the seafood and fruits. This is esp so for the stall facing the main road... if you go inner side of the market, you should find some steals.

This is where you can have the best seafood Hokkaido can offer, the king crabs are live! The freshest scallops, oysters and uni! They also have live hairy crabs! We come here every December just before Christmas to have these delicacy. And we will be coming back for more!

For fresh king and snow crab lovers, Nijo market is a must go. Price is so reasonable compare to where I come from. Boil or BBQ both are tasty and sweet. I would recommend to go for the first stall, they guy is so friendly and good business guy.
We bought 1 whole crab go back hotel eat, very shiok!! Fruits are fresh.. Quite an interesting place
So so. We went around 4pm and most of the shops were still opened. Tourist spot and not a must to go if you have no time. Not crowded.

I fried some of the shrimp, sea urchin, scallop and oysters they are extremely fresh and rejoicing in your mouth. We kept coming back for breakfast in 2 days. They also serve not coffee with Hokkaido milk in the bottle, it taste very smooth

Do go early as the fresh supplies reduce as the day passes and some items maybe sold out before the end of the day. Fresh seafood can be selected and cooked at the restaurant. A great place to savour the local fresh seafood supplies, from King Crab to Sashimi.

Fresh seafood and loads of crabs. It’s a touristy spot and many of the shop owners speak fluent English. Recommend to walk around and take in the sights and the prices! Nevertheless a wonderful experience.

Great place to "see" seafood :-), a lot of Fresh seafoods to choose from, there are shops, too, selling dried seafoods. Shopped here for really yummy dried seafoods that we took home. You can even have fresh seafoods cooked for you, stores actually have their own restaurants

We went there because a friend recommended it to us especially for uni so we went there and ate the donburi. The uni and ikura were so fresh and tasty. If you like sashimi then this is the place to go in Sapporo, they have many types of sashimi.

If you're a fan of seafood, this is one place you must visit. Not as touristy as the one in Tokyo, but a good place to buy fresh crabs and other creatures which taste good in garlic butter. Check out Ohiso - small bowls of urchin / salmon/ roe/ sashimi rice that won't fill you

Centrally located in the Sapporo City which allow easy access to the market. Fish looks quite fresh and the dried seafood looks good too. My mum bought some scallop at 4500 yen. But the market is too small to make it a trip worthy of travel so visit only if you are near the

If in Sapporo plan a visit to Nijo Market to see, smell, taste, king crab(Tarabagani), hairy crab( kegani), and rare Hanasaki crabs on ice. There is a myriad of other fresh and dried, smoked seafood products such as sea urchins(uni), scallops(hotate), shrimp(ama ebi), Okhotsk
Good location as its walkable from Sapporo city centre or Odori park. one of the stall at the corner have a 5-in-1 don which is very value for money.

The Nijo market is right beside the Tanukikoji Shopping Arcade, easily accessible by a short walk. We went there on a weekday afternoon. The place was quiet and no queues for restaurants (great!). The sashimi they have are the freshest ones I've ever had in my life. Very

This is 1 of 2 seafood markets in Sapporo. This being the closest to city center & more touristy. Not as big as the wholesale market. Still worth a stop though. Always like walking around morning markets in Japan. Lots to see, try & buy. Also a great stop for some fresh seafood

The market is not difficult to find, walk by all the stores that are displaying all the seafood to get an idea of the pricings. We picked one store as shown in the pictures n selected crab legs to be lightly grilled. We were given a discount n were directed to a small shop

Very small seafood market, where you can buy fish, crabs and some fruits. Quite expensive and not much of choice. If you come from Far East where seafood is not an exotic, it is not worth going to Nijo

We came for a stroll through the market and couldn't say no to trying some of the Hokkaido king crab. It's not cheap but a must do for seafood lovers. I would recommend the J Soul Brothers shop which is right on the corner and they have a restaurant across the road. We ordered a
It's a small neighborhood "fish market" with fresh seafood of all types. I've bought packaged dried snacks here to bring back as gifts and eaten their fresh sashimi abalane and tuna. So deelish!

If you would like to see live seafood in water tanks, Nijo market will disappoint you. It's a small market with almost no live seafood in tanks. We did see about 2 stalls with live seafood but the selectionnis pathetic. As we had been to Curb Market innour earlier trip, Nijo

Come here first for breakfast before going for shopping in the alley. I didn't expect the market to be so small but despite that, there are lots to choose from. Mainly tourists here. We had our snow crab here and it was delicious. Donburi is also very good here. Go in

Now it's about tourists. (I'm Japanese) and I saw lots of visitors outside of Japan. They told me they can pack and send to outside like Hong Kong. So you can purchase them here without worrying about how to carry it back. I was told that business with tourists are smaller

Not a very big market, and because we visited during the end of winter, it was a little wet and messy. Though, it's not very crowded and it's a good place for souvenir purchasing. Other than seafood, you will also get to buy chocolates and various kind of Japanese snacks here.
Delicious fresh seafood, well-worth a visit. Go early and have an amazing breakfast! Food was very affordable and delicious.

Must visit Nijo Market when you are in Hokkaido, Japan. This market is easy to access from Sapporo City center. Since the market is located in the center of Sapporo, this market attracts visitors who are looking for fresh crabs, shrimp, scallops and so many other seafoods caught

Nijo Market is quite small when compared to the Tsukiji Market, but its size adds to the market's charm. It is less crowded and very central to the city center. We found a small family owned restaurant to have our first Kaisendon. Very tasty...if you're into raw seafood, you'll

If your time in Sapporo city is limited , then Nijo market is the place to head to as it's located in the city center . It's located very near to the Sapporo Tower about 150m away . It is primary a seafood wet market selling fresh giant crabs and all sorts of fresh seafood .

There are alot of such markets all over Japan . This one is small compared to others, especially in Hakodate. There are some dining outlets within but generally not very interesting. However, it is always worth a visit to "new" attractions, as one never know what to expect
The number of shops and selection of goods is better here than the Central Wholesale Market. Its location near the main Sapporo city area makes this the better alternative for seafood in Sapporo.

Compared to the fish markets in various cities, this one us definitely very touristy. The usual colourful displays of fishes, crabs and sea urchins were the but the food seems over priced. Nothing special about this place. Can skip if you don't have time in sapporo.

Nijo market is just 2 blocks east of Tanukikoji Shopping street in easy walking distance. The market is large enough to offer good variety & competitive prices and small enough to be an enjoyable leisurely experience for 4 seniors exploring Sapporo for the first time. We

There are many food stalls and stalls were selling fresh seafood here. We tried the hokkaido grilled scallop and it was extremely great and fresh ! We also bought a fresh hokkaido king crab and brought it to the restaurant! definitely a must visit market in hokkaido
we visited at around 8am (as recommended), but it was a 5 minutes visit. not to much to see, but its located in the center, so worth the 5 minutes visit.

Japan is the land of my favorite cuisine mainly because of sashimi. I went to Nijo Market in Sapporo hoping to get my fill of fresh Hokkaido scallops and crab and it definitely went above and beyond my expectations. First restaurant I tried there was Ohiso, the second one was a

We visited at about 3pm in the afternoon on a Fiday. The market is supposed to be still open as it is not a morning market. However, while almost every shop was still open, the whole ambience is not lively. Not what one might expect from a market of this size. Could it be

The market itself is quite small, but oh my goodness the size of those snow crabs. It's not cheap to eat here, considering the fact that it is a market. Also can be a bit touristy. However, we had incredible fresh seafood donburi here. Uni-don, chirashi, and the snow crab

Nijo Fish Market is opposite Tanukikoji Shopping Arcade Section 1. The stalls mainly sell fresh seafood, some of which can be cooked on the spot. One of the more outstanding stalls sold a crab-related set consisting of crab gratin, steamed crab bun, and crab miso soup. Using
Typical tourist must see place. I find the Curb Market, slightly off the beaten track, near the Soen JR station with better vibes & slightly more authentic as a wholesale seafood market.

First time to visit Sapporo, also our first family trip, don't want to miss some seafoods that's why Nijo Market is on our list. Not bad for a 1000 Yen per bowl, i can say we're satisfied & definitely will go back again. Next time we will try the Ramen.

This is a small market with a good range of local seafood, including some small, friendly and well-priced restaurants. The place is a bit run down and not as lively as many I have visited in Japan but not far off the beaten, shopping path. Visit if only for a great lunch of

Nijo market is comparatively smaller than some other markets we visited, but nevertheless there is a good range of seafoods & dried foodstuff to choose from. The foods are fresh, however, we do find it a little pricy. If you are also visiting Hakodate, I would recommend the

If you're planning to stay at Sapporo by winter Dec-Feb, you must visit Nijo Market. From Tanukikoji Chrome 7 shopping district may takes 10 minutes walk. The best place for Alaskan giant crab hunting; cost around MYR380-MYR600. But worth of money spend here. For once in a life

As I said, I think you can get better deals overall at Otaru. But if you are not going to Otaru, you can bargain and get decent prices since there are enough stalls for competition for your business. Restaruants - we ate directly across the street on the corner, small

As it is located near odori park and other tour points, this market is very convenient to access easily within 10 minutes by walk. There are some fish don restaurants and many fish markets. You can enjoy real fresh seafoods and fish don here. Very good location !

Nijo market is situated on one end of Tanuki-koji pedestrian street. However, no much foods outlets/restaurants and the price of seafoods seem to be much higher than Sapporo city. Environment wise, smelly and not so hygenic; I could prefer to eat in restaurants or food outlets

We visited Nijo Market 2 times in 2 days ! We enjoyed our rustic dining experience at Nijo Market. You can select your own Hairy Crab, Scallops & Clams & have them steam & also grill it for you & eat it there! A very special tasty experience. The live crabs, scallops and

Vacations cholesterol doesn't count! The seafood are so fresh and so sweet that they are worth every penny! Yes, they are not cheap, but at least money well spent. Recommend to come here by public transport, we drove and it was tough getting a carpark lot in peak hours.

The fish market is a series of individual seafood stall holders selling a wide array of seafood. Crab is king and there is a variety of crab species to choose from. We chose our King Crab legs to be cooked and 10 minutes later they were delivered to restaurant across the road.
A must see if you like seafood. Seafoods here are cheaper than in restaurants. Almost all shops offers to cook the seafood for you and you will eat it just in the side of the street.
Not big comparing with other fish market in Japan. So it's not very interesting if you visit here just for looking.

The must visit market in Sapporo, morning Nijo market. We have breakfast here and the first time eat giant crab and love the sweet strawberry. Many items we can buy but suggest to eat kind of seafoods.

A nice seafood market with many hidden shops in the alleys behind it. You'd be surprised at the number of small shops hidden in the back alleys, where they cook and serve the fresh seafood. Interesting place to see and discover new places to eat. The front is where all the

Compared with the Tsukiji Outer Market and the Curb Market in Sapporo, Nijo Market is tiny. There are the usual vendors with fresh seafood that can be bought and cooked on the spot, but relatively few vendors of fresh fruits/vegetables and dried goods. The whole market probably
We visited Nijo Market, hoping for various snack items in sight but the place was actually a literal wet market. We didn't eat at all. We just walked and looked around.

A seafood market located in central area of Sapporo. There are many shops selling fresh seafood (crab, prawn, fish, sea shell etc), and they can cook them for you there. The price is cheaper comparing to Tokyo and Osaka.
The seafood is not as fresh as those in otaru. If you're going otaru, can skip the seafood here. Can still go nijo to have a look, nothing much tho'.

Seems to me the sole purpose of Nijo market was just built for tourist. No doubt the seafood was fresh but this is in Hokkaido! I wouldn't expect anything less than fresh! Prices weren't cheap and nothing really much to see.

Nijo market is located at one end of the Tanukikoji shopping arcade. Stores selling seafood, fruits etc can be found and they are open from 7am to 6pm. All seafood looks delicious and fresh. You could choose your desired seafood and let them cook for you or if not, patronized

This market have lots of shops selling fresh/dry seafood and fruits. Instead of going to the restaurant on the main street, e went to a restaurant in the small alley way and Seafood bowl rice for breakfast and a restaurant for dinner. It is a little expensive when compare to

Good place to visit while in the city. It's a small market that's easy to get to. Most stores sell the same things but may be of different quality (e.g. dried scallops). Make sure you shop around. In some sense the stores do seem to cater towards tourists rather than locals.

We went here at 7 am and the lengthy walk at subzero temperatures was worth it. The sushi is fresh and there are a bunch of restaurants where you can get a variety of seafood that is otherwise harder to find in the rest of meat-loving Sapporo. It's also nice to wander around the

Visited Nijo Market twice during my tour in Sapporo. Mainly we were there for the seafoods that there could offer specially the King Crabs. If you go in a group of said... 4 - 5 persons and order plenty of seafoods and divide out the bills. It's actually not that pricey after

Visited Nijo Market consecutively 2 years during the month of April, the seasonal produce at the time as Asparagus, Corns, Strawberries and more... If you'll like to experience and get premium + high quality local produce at the most affordable price, this is the place! Also
Was here on 3rd Feb 2017 and had a steamed king crab and some other dishes. Excellent fresh seafood. Be aware some shops do not let you take photographs.

Wasn't a pleasant experience, few variety and no variations between the stalls. They are all selling the same thing - snow crabs, oysters, dried scallops etc. Not cheap and you get people trying to sell you something at every stall. I did not feel comfortable and wanted to

If eating exotic seafood is your thing this is the place. Four different kinds of crabs for you to try. - KIng Crab. Snow Crab, Hairy Crab and Hanasaki Crab. Freah Sea Urchin, Oysters, Scallops, Snails, Whelk are swimming in the water tank.

Offers a lot of variety of seafood. You can also buy little souvenir while waiting for your hairy/king crab to be cooked by the vendors. They even offer you mega discounts if you happen to shop few minutes before they close shops :)

Had a walked towards Nijo market on Wednesday morning. Wasn't impress at all. Very few variety and the shops were too few and unexciting. Seafood looked normal. Had some and can't even remember the name of the restaurant, but the food was so so and not worth the price we paid.
We had the best seafood here. There are so many choices and the prices are reasonable. The main thing is that seafood is so fresh here.
What am I going to do with a $100 USD frozen King Crab?? Eating places WAY WAY over priced, nothing worthy hear, and that includes the so-called Sapporo Wholesale Market.

This market is filled with Seafood like king crab, scallop, octopus, etc. The stall holder will automatically give you discount on certain products as there are so many competitors. Should try your raw seafood - salmon, marlin, sea urchin, etc. The king crab is awesome, fresh,
This is the only place we could find breakfast (didn't want to eat hotel breakfast) They serve yummy sashimi, crab, oysters and etc

We got lots of fresh seafood and produce over here. Perhaps we were there during holiday - Dec 30 - so there weren't many selection or variety like we have hoped (compared to a few days earlier in Hakodate). But still had good quality stuff, all the famous Japanese seafood are

Going here is via Tohoe subway line then exit at ODORI station. Upon exit you will see the Odori Park, facing Odori park, just cross one time to the other street then just go straight for about 5mins. We turned to WAZE for directions since NO SIGNS FOR DIRECTIONS TO THE NIJO

Love the fresh seafood. If you love crabs, you must visit this market where you can pick the crab and have it freshly cooked. Most shops sell similar things. Not as busy as Tsukiji in Tokyo where you have battle your way through. Worth a visit

Just stay near Nijo market whenever you visit Sapporo. It's the best place *period* Have been to other parts of Japan and you just can't beat the quality and price here. Note that I am referencing to feeding a family of 7 (2 teenagers whom can eat a mountain). The seafood here

Many shops selling fresh fish, different types of crabs, clams mussels oysters... Also has shops selling dried scallops and other food stuff. These are quite reasonably priced if you look around first before buying it there. Has restaurants there too. Most serving donburi.

I recommend a trip to Nijo market in the early morning followed by a walk at Tanukikoji (shopping street) in the late morning. Thereafter, you can enjoy a 5 star lunch at Ohiso (see my review of this restaurant) before taking a stroll at Odori Park. This takes up more than half

A short walk from the Odori Station, this market is small, most of them selling crabs such as snow crab and flower crab, scallops and sea urchins. Some of the stalls offer free samples or sell the seafood cooked in front of you. Some of the stalls also sells dried scallops and

This is the seafood market of Sapporo. Unlike the tsusuki market in Tokyo, this place is much smaller. However, you can still find all the seafood that you need at this market. There are a number of eateries selling seafood as well. They do have dried seafood products on sale

Although there have a variety of seafood, the highlight of this place are the crabs. There's a few variety but the most popular is the king crab however for me, the best is the flower crab because it's the sweetest and most flavourable of the crabs there. Check with the shop as

Was there yesterday 7th Dec, small market with limited live seafood. Ate 6 pieces of sashimi at a small stall with lots of name card and foreign currency.Very inflated price compared to other locations. Must do some research and ask prices before order.

One of the best crab and seafood market! It is quite small, but best snow crabs! Reasonable price and friendly staff. We visited the first store in the corner, you can have a warm seating place across the street if you purchase from that shop. Loved it!!!
Compared to Hakodate morning market, this one is smaller than expected, but less crowded of people, and lots of seafood.
Nice place to sample local catch and seafood. Can be quite pricy for a bowl of rice but its definitely worth a visit.
Food is ok. Pretty small place overall. Sankaku @ Otaru is way better. But in the November rain, the sheltered walkway all the way is welcomed.

It was located within walking distance from my hotel (Tsubaki Premier Hotel) and opens up from 7.30am onwards. If you are into freshly harvested salmon roe, sea urchin, scallops, expensive snow crabs and rock melon, do pay a visit to this neighbourhood market. Language is not

There are lots of stalls along the front of the market selling fresh seafood - served fresh or cooked on the spot. Just be careful about the prices advertised for the crabs - they are indicative only and can be negotiated down.

Had my breakfast here in one of the seafood shop, easily the most expensive breakfast in my life. Typical Hokkaido seafood street with tanks outside displaying crabs of all sorts and if you are ready to splurge, they can prepare you a shashimi out of the crab of your choice on
Just 2 stretch of shops and a few restaurant. Nothing compared to Tokyo tsukiji n hakodate market. Had breakfast in one of the restaurant and they have a good gesture of taking photo with crab for us

If you love going to explore local culture and you love markets, then you must go here early in the morning. While it may be a small fish market compared to others in Japan, it is very historic and full of happy people selling crabs and all sorts of live and fresh fish. The
no longer wat it used to be as too many tour buses and tourists r headed out there . prices are way too high and quality of merchandise questionable. not your typical Japanese location anymore

This is way nearer to JR Station and where I stayed - took a leisurely walk from Keio Plaza Hotel through the historic Akarenga (Old Government House), then through scenic Odori park and Clock Tower (tokei dai) and finally over to this fish market... trip was well-rewarded
If you love exotic fresh seafood you must visit this market. A word of caution, most of its restaurants are known for their raw seafood dishes.

Visit only if you are within the vicinity. The market is very small and have limited eateries. Its a good market to visit to buy dried seafood as there are quite a no of stalls so you can get some pretty good discounts.
Must visit place for local gourmet such as delicious seafood, sashimi donburi. A lot of eateries but price is slightly higher.

Although I don't eat seafood I was interested in taking a look at this market. It is quite small but very interesting, with lots of fresh crabs, either whole or legs for sale and strangely lots of melons for sale - the prices of these were astounding, I will never complain at

Went there for lunch and was very for the range of fresh seafood on offer. You can go for the most expensive live snow crabs or just a crab miso for a few hundred yens. The shops selling dry goods are typical buyers beware. Some offering huge discounts (before you open your
Dried seafood are available for sale too. I went to a resto there for lunch and the seafood were all served very fresh and delicious. See the photo attached. Fresh and wet food were in good quality!

This is an unpretentious seafood market just at the end of Tanikokuji shopping street. Best place to have fresh crabs, chirashi, grilled scallops, uni, ebiko and an assortment of sashimi & sushi. Value for money considering the price.

Getting very excited to visit this unique place , we went very early at around 7am. Unfortunately , it was just too early , only 2 stalls opened and the other fews just get preparation. Did not see any restaurant opened, does no venture. Still be able to see a few varieties

This is a very small market. Went to Keiran which is at the corner of the market . Had the chutoro sushi ( 370 yen per sushi) . It was excellent . Tried their specialty grilled hamachi with salt . It was so so good . Should try it (780 yen ) . It is limited on a daily basis .

We went in Jan 2016, it was very Sapporo but because we were stayed very close to the hotel, so it only took us 10 mins to walk to Nijo Market. We went to the market at around 11 am, only a few restaurants were opened ( it was a big market market anyway). We did not have any

Small selection of stalls selling produce and a number of them selling seafood. There are some stalls that offer sashimi or BBQ if you buy the seafood on the spot. There is also a stall that allows you to select the crabs within the tanks with spaces for dining on the spot, as

Never have I seen a live king crab before. We were fortunate to come across a friendly lady of a stall where we spotted the sea creatures in tank. She offered to cook for us to taste the sweet delicious meat of the crabs including a hairy crab and scallops. Not only that, we had
Fresh and dry seafood can be bought here at a much cheaper price then other places. There are also many food stalls where they will cook for you after buying fresh seafood at the market.
Nijo Market is a small market that sells fresh seafood and fruits. You can walk around to browse through the fresh produce. We also had lunch there.

We had (in our view) the best sashimi we've ever had (at Shiro which is at the Nijo Market). There are also a lot of other eateries there. Fresh produce (seafood, crabs etc , Hokkaido corn, melons) are also available .. I am not sure what it is (volcano ash??) but the corn and

Nothing much to see in this market for us as my children don't like seafood. Just few shop selling same seafood products. Good for those who like seafood products. Few blocks from the Sapporo tv clock tower and exit from odori subway underground no.35. Use Google map, easy to
A lot of reasonable price seafoods and fresh with rice in the morning. I try one restaurant the area and it taste very good.
I tried some restaurants around Nijo Market and it was impressive. Sushi was really good with reasonable price.

We went here twice during our 3 weeks trip in Hokkaido. Definitely worth a visit for those who want to eat sashimi and king crab. Don't forget to bargain if you plan to buy the crab. They can cut thousands of yen if you're buying a whole crab.

It's a small morning market @ sapporo and nothing if you compare it against Tsukiji market in Tokyo or Nishiki market in Kyoto. However having said that, I will still recommend to pay a visit to this market as you will find bargains on food that you cannot find in Honshu island

Great fish market taking up about a block in downtown Sapporo. There is a vast quantity of all different sorts of fresh seafood from shellfish, crustaceans, mollusks and fish. All appear very fresh and are beautifully displayed on ice or live in tanks. Too bad we don't get
Not much here. Disappointed with the number of retailers and choices. Not much atmosphere. All retailers keen to offer discounts
Pasar ini sangat kecil sekali, harga yg ditawarkan juga sangat mahal, you can have better quality and cheaper price of food even in the citose airport, so just skip it, and find another place to go

This is one of our favorite breakfast/brunch spot in Sapporo. Find Donburi-chaya and check out their "today's special". Price is decent, quality is above good. Been here Dec 2014 and June 2016. Never fails to satisfy.
We went too early in the day, and not many shops were open. The ones we went past were quite pricey, and hence it was quite disappointing. Definitely go later in the day if you can
Had breakfast there.. It's a very touristy market. Not so authentic. The food is not cheap either. It's OK to stop there for a couple of hours but don't expect too much

Not big and spectacular but it's worth a visit. Some store staff are friendly . For eg this shop ( see photo) I would recommend . Friendly staff and even if you don't patronise they let you try boiled blue crab/ king crab :)

Again we have visited Nijo Market by early June. The market stalls were more or less the same since our visit last year. However, we found that the prices have risen. Anyway, tourists would go to this market and purchased their dried seafood back home and tried the fresh
This market is very small and has only a few stalls and hardly any eateries. Food were a bit expensive. Not worth visiting. It is fine if just to go there for a look and photo taking.

Feast your eyes and your culinary taste buds with some of the freshest offering from the sea. Crabs, crabs and crabs all varieties big and small, sea urchins, roes, crab legs, you cant help but be amazed at what you can find at this market all in one place. You will never

My first interaction with Nijo Fisk Market was the restaurant on the leftmost edge of Nijo. They had an array of fresh seafood meal options and I just had to try the 5 part meal including 3 small donburi (seafood on rice) bowls with ikura (salmon roe), scallops, and sea urchin,
It is only a row of shops selling the normal seafood items, nothing to shout about and prices are not cheap. Better to buy at Hachinoche or Hakodate market

Food are OK here, but are expensive compare to the other small sea food restaurants at Sapporo. Two of us ate one medium size crab (6400), a rice bowl bento (2900), and a barbecue sea urchin (1000) for breakfast.
This market is very small and has only a few stalls and hardly any eateries. Very pathetic place. Not worth visiting

We went here for breakfast. Had seafood donburi and crab miso soup. Cost $40 for two people. The crab was tasteless and proportions small. Save you money for other parts of Japan. Sapporo is an overpriced tourist trap in general and this market is really nothing much.

We missed both the Tsukiji market in Tokyo and the morning market in Hakodate but wanted to get one experience of a Japanese seafood market. It's very small and there's not much other than to buy seafood to take away or eat in one of the restaurants, and we did the latter at

I visited this place about 15 year's ago and remembered it was bigger and people were more friendly. But now, its a bit smaller than I remembered and it seemed to miss the fish market atmosphere which made it a unique place to visit. A bit disappointed. But it still has some

How can you come sapporo without coming here for the seafood experience! No reason not to visit, it's just mouth watering looking at all the seafood freshly caught sold and prepared to your appetite here with a real reasonable price !! Best to visit between 6-8am :)

This small market has stalls selling fresh seafood and seafood restaurants. I did not eat any seafood here because the prices appears higher than those in Hakodate where I was a few days earlier. I noticed they sell octopus eyes too. Guess its a local delicacy? Overall, I spent

This is certainly the place to go for fresh seafoods. King crabs and giant scallops abound, the fresh catch offered never seems to end. But be careful when selecting your seafood stall or restaurant to enjoy yourself. There are a few seafoods business there that take advantage
Nice little fish market near Odori and within walking distance. Local experience with fresh sushi and sashimi. Worth a visit here before venturing into the shopping area across the road.
Get the freshest choices of seafood at this market. Furthermore, a few restaurants within serve fantastic Shashimi.

Went there early in the morning at 7am. The seafood shops are not as many as in Tokyo Tsukiji Market. Great to visit if you prefer quiet market. Tourists are advised to walk through the shops first and check the price tags before buying. Some shops allow price bargaining and
not much to see compare to tsukiji. the freshly open sea urchin also not the best quality. theres a few souvenir shops instead of fresh seafood and restaurants.

There's a lot of fresh seafood (scallop,sea urchin, crabs,raw fish etc) you can choose to either eat them raw or cooked! Price mostly from 1900 yen to 3000 yen per set.Worth to pay a visit as you can see lots of big fresh seafood there! And I even saw a stall selling whale meat.

It is very difficult to go wrong with Japanese seafood markets. The food they serve here is excellent and fresh. Can try some grilled hotate and uni by the road side. Especially satisfying in winter with a cup of sake

A must visit place if you're in Sapporo. Rows of fresh seafood from oysters to hairy crabs on display. You could have your lunch at the small restaurants which offer set lunch at a very reasonable price. I would highly recommend this place if you're visiting Sapporo for the

Fresh seafood galore. There are seafood shops selling all sorts of fresh fish, crab, oysters, clams and sea urchin. Great for visitors and locals alike - you can. Buy fresh seafood and they will grill it on the spot for you. Try one of the seafood bowls (many shops on the inside

Lots of fresh seafood and good prices for the fresh seafood. The restarurants selling dons are also serving good portion with delicious seafood slices. The sea urchins sold here are very delicious and scallops sold here also way cheaper than other places.

I think one of the other reviewers summed this up, when the place is full of tourist and hardly any locals is this really the fish market to go to? Prices seem to be steep as well. 2 King crab legs cost 5000 yen. Have to say they cooked them well and cut them perfect, all the
It is very touristy and prices are geared towards tourists. Go there to have a look around the market.
lots of fresh seafood stall along the street selling crabs, urchins and all other fantastic treats. there is a few small restaurant in there that is definitely worth a visit
A small market opposite Tanuki Koji shopping arcade. Restaurants and shops for seafoods. If you want to buy things here, kindly bargain for a better price.
Great place! Fresh sashimi, and yummy uni. Had good crab miso soup and crab meat bun located right at the start of the fish market. Possible to haggle prices for scallops too !

This market can be easily visited since it is centrally located. Here, most produce and seafood are repetitively sold by the stalls that lined the market. Overall it was an enjoyable experience since there were hardly any tourist during our visit. However, we did notice that the

We walked along the seafood shops from the entrance of Nijo Market. There was this shop at the road side selling live seafood and cooking. You will see there are pictures where visitors (famous people) took together with the owner. The prices of the seafood is fairly cheap. Four

Easy to get to. Good selection of snow crabs...one shop will boil it for you on the spot to be eaten there and then. About 6 little restaurants around the market. 5 minute walking distance to Odori park.

To get there, you can call for the shuttle or take a bus. The shuttle will drop you off at their shop. It's not obligatory to buy there, but the restaurant up top is very good value. We had lunch in one of the restaurants and it costs about 70% of what you might pay in a

Choices of stalls are limited. Prices are over rated. If you see more tourists than locals in a fish market, my advise is do not buy anything there. You'd be shocked to see for something similar with a price tag 2 to 3 times higher. That's if you realize it.

Excellent slabs of sashimi served. We tried the salmon sashimi, fatty tuna sashimi (excellent, a must-order dish), grilled squid, buttered scallop, scallop sashimi (excellent, a must-order dish), king crab don (not so good, can give it a miss), uni mix with crab and tuna don.

Nijo market is small but still plenty to see and eat. Many of the stores are linked to restaurants so you can pick out the crabs you want and have them cooked for you. You can also have oysters shucked there and eat them. There's also some fresh produce. There are eateries
It's expensive if compare to Hakodate fish market. These market are similar in moat of the Hokkaido town like Otaru, tomakomai

We have visited this market for two times during our trip in sapporo. You can find a restaurant nearby to enjoy Sashimi Rice Bowl, or to buy a fresh crab for taking away. We proposed to buy a crab in one of the shop, however we are not sure where we can cook it. The shop keeper

The fresh seafood market is pretty small, smaller than what it looks like in the photos. Since every stalls here sells almost the same thing, so decided to hop into one of it with uni, scallop and king crab on the menu! The price was affordable, way affordable than eating the

This is a great Japanese fish market selling fresh crabs, seafood, sea urchin, seaweed, salmon etc. The Hokkaido crabs look sensational and the stall holders are happy to freshly cook the crabs at the spot so you can enjoy it straight away. The price is so much cheaper compared

This is the place if you want to buy dried or fresh seafood from scallops to crabs. The king crabs here is very fresh and delicious. We bought one big king crab and the stall owner brought us to the opposite restaurant to cook it for us. From one crab,we have sashimi, steam

We enjoy our seafood at nijo market. You can find king crab,hairy crab & a lot of fresh seafood here.From tanukikoji shopping arcade,just walk straight to odori station.from nijo market,we can go to tv tower,odori park,clock tower.they are in walking distance in 1 area

Not as impressive as the Tokyo Tsukiji Market, but this is the rightful place for Hokkaido's famous long legged King Crab. Fortunately, we did not have the bad experience of any stale substitute, rather, we found the corner store keeper pretty decent in his recommendation and

We are having the big crab and can be eat for 10 person. Cost for the crab 10,000 yen. And we can order gohan in the small resto. The crab is so nice. I never eatthat fresh crab before.try the melon ice cream. Taste great. We really recommend.

The store at the corner closest to the traffic light, who has a small eatery acorss the road, which gave free crab samples. We bought the whole red flower crab, but found out later that half the red flower crab was stale and tasteless. Only half was served fresh and juicy !

It's a small market. Not many shops for shopping, besides, mostly were dried products, fishes, crabs, and fruits. Guess just not a suitable place for foreign tourists but probably okay for local people. After all, some products might not be able to be carried back to some

This was our first fish market so we went in without any expectations. We were blown away. We sampled salmon jerky, bought fresh sashimi, cracked open fresh uni, and ate a beautiful salmon donburi at one of the many small restaurants that are interspersed between fish stands.

Went to this market with high expectation was left a bit disappointing, the platform I was comparing was Hakodate so I would give this one a skip, Sapporo Jyogai Market is better then this one IMO. More stores and more lively.

After eating at the seafood restaurant called the "Kaisen-Shokudo Kitano Gourmet-tei" I felt that it seems that "We Harvested the Ocean". Nothing bad to say about this place even though some people will say that this is sort of a tourist trap. The food was perfectly done and

We bought 2 crabs a the shop in the corner. One flower crab and hairy crab. The shop keepers were friendly and willing to provide a discount. They cook it fresh for you and you can eat it at the restaurant on the opposite side of the road :) crabs had lots of meat and sweet!

I was expecting it to be bigger at first. It was only 2 half-blocks big. Nevertheless, there were many fresh sea creatures to be tried. They offer to cook everything you buy be it Hokkaido crabs, Scallops, or fish. The price is not so cheap though and the place is very touristy
Small traditional seafood wholesale market. There were tons of different seafood. We got very excited to see the different crabs.

the best place to hunt for seafood specially all the crab you can take, cooked frozen, chilled or even lived. i choose lived king crab that cost me usd175. worth it as it was cooked immediately 2 way, boiled and grill. my yummy breakfast at no market

the location is closer to our hotel than the big wholesale market. so we went there to have our breakfast which is sashimi and rice. Price is quite expensive comparing to other bigger market. But this place is more touristy.

Nijo Fish Market is relatively small when compare with fish market in Tokyo. Not so many restaurants to choose from. But for us, it's one of the most memorable place in this trip. We were there not for the fish, but for the crab. April is the season for Hokkaido hairy crab and

Sapporo's Nijo Fish market is smaller than the Tsujiki Fish Market in Tokyo, but it's also less crowded, making it possible to take your time and enjoy the market at your own pace (tasting samples, chatting with the vendors, taking pictures, etc.). This is also an advantage

We visited on a Wednesday around 11:30am and a lot of the stalls in the market were closed. Of the stalls opened, there were plenty of King Crab and Uni available for great photos. On another Trip Advisor contributor's recommendation, we walked into the heart of the market

If you love sashimi this is the place for you! You can get a very very fresh and big scallop for 300 to 600 JPY and ask them to prepare the sashimi for you. Other items are good too. Some shop has a cut of Otoro (maybe around 300g) with a price of 2,500 JPY! I've tried it the

About 30 minutes walk from Sapporo Station (JR.), there are a lot to see and shop along the tunnel... Exit at shopping street #3. Yummy king crab at reasonable price...buy and eat instantly! Look for anyone with restaurant.

The vendors were generous in giving samples, but we didn't feel obliged to buy what they're selling. We bought some and the seafood was really good. I'm a seafood lover so I'm biased. I loved the dried ready-to-eat squid flakes and dried salmon. We also bought a big dried squid

I have visited the Tsukiji fish market in Tokyo on multiple occasions so was a bit skeptical about Nijo given the small size. It turns out that this is its greatest advantage as we were able to enjoy huge portions of unbelievably fresh seafood without the long waits of Tuskiji.
The market was deserted when I visited on a weekday during lunch. It's an average market, but worth visiting just to see the live seafood and the crabs and sea urchin.

For those expecting Tsukiji tuna auctions and magnitude, think again. It's just a small market selling fresh seafood and one of the few places in Japan where bargaining with the vendors is not frowned upon. Prices aren't exactly cheap, but hey, at least the seafood is guaranteed

The store owners didn't push us to buy anything. We found a small restaurant inside and they serve really fresh and delicious seafood. We even tried steamed whale milt! We spent less than USD100 for 3 of us and we had sea urchin, salmon roe, salmon, scallop, dried hoke fish,

Go early for the fish/seafood market action. Surrounding it is shops that sell fresh seafood. Hokkaido crabs are humongous and plenty of fish, roe, dried squid, grilled squid, etc for sale. Plenty of restaurants serving the fresh seafood too. Must try their crabs, urchin, toro,
Things are expensive here. Go to the central wholesale market instead of this place. Surprised that the store owners are not friendly.

After we been to hakodate market, we felt this place is boring. The vendors are quite intimidating too and we dare not even go near. Not worth the visit unless this is your first time exploring such market in hokkaido.
You can find a lot of fresh seafood here, delicious sashimi-donburi, I recommend to try fresh sweet corn, nice and friendly shopkeeper. Oh I wanna get back there.

If you like sushimi and looking for fresh sashimi, this is one of the places. I have 5 small rice bowls with 5 kinds of seafood. Fresh scallop, fresh sea uni, fresh salmon and salmon roe, king crab leg...portion is well enough for one person..cost yen2080. Person who love

I was there from 20-22 July 2014. Summer and you can walk around in shorts and t-shirt. Not cold at all. Certain days, it rains but last for max a couple of hours then. Nijo market was just a short walk away from my hotel - ANA Hotel Sapporo. As you approach, do note that

If you enjoy sushimi and really looking for quality Sushimi, this is the place. Fresh grill sea scallop, fresh sea Uni and you can order crab prepare anyway you want. Not too many restaurant have air conditioner but seafood is great.

We went because they recommended that place, there were basically fish and seafood, but we went in the morning, we found a little restaurant, handled by 3 old ladies, very traditional, was the most delicious seafood and crab that I ever eaten! Very fresh, beautiful presentation,
there are restaurant to have hot food. We bot live crabs and got a restaurant to serve them hot and even have crab miso soup. Yummy !

We spent about an hour wandering the various shops and comparing prices before buying what we wanted - dried scallops and crab! And then we sat at the shop to eat -- OMG! The uni was premium!! Wish I could remember the name of the eatery, it was across the soft serve ice

Spent a short time here on our trip in Sapporo. We had a great rice bowl with uni (sea urchin), ikura (salmon roe) and crab. Great for a quick bite to eat, nice and fresh and cost about 2,500 yen. Unfortunately as an international tourist we weren't able to purchase much of the

Went on Sunday a bit before noon. Few shops open and literally dead. Did find some good deals on some crabs so was pretty happy about that. Not worth going unless you want to buy something. The bigger main market is probably better.

Located at corner of traffic junction. Small and able to browse through within half an hour if not buying nor eating there. Make up of many small stalls selling somewhat similar seafood products, mainly. Both fresh and dried products available. Bought 2 vacuum-packed ready to

I realised I was here 4 years ago with a tour group Better if your free and easy Had sea urchin roe for 1000 yen each right out if the shell Fresh as can be Be prepared to go home with crab legs, dry scallops Prices vary a little so walk around Easy access is to go via the

Perhaps I came by at the right time, the prices were okay. I spent around 70 usd for 2 full sets of grilled salmon and mixed seafood (sea urchin, prawns, etc.), two half-portion of fatty tuna and salmon donburi, two bowls of large crab miso soup, two portions of baked scallops,

This market is small but it is close to city center. You can even walk back to the JR station from here and it would take you less than half an hour. We had a snow crab, conches, sea urchins and scallops. The seafood was delicious as they were fresh. Cooking was simple -

The main reason people come to this market is because it sells fresh seafood material such as scallop and king crab. The other reason? you can bargain the price, if you are good enough you can even get a half price over the original price it's written. so don't forget to

Just to the east of the Tanukikoji shopping arcade is the Sapporo Nijo Market, a small fish and vegetable market selling fresh seafood including the famous king crab(tarabagani). There you will find fresh seafood, dried seafood, and fresh vegetables from the Hokkaido farms. In

The area is small and the shops are almost all the same, The prices were 60% above the real market prices. There are only tourists and the only tourists buying were Japanese from small out of the way towns.

Maybe my expectation was high but I was really disappointed to find a quiet market catering mainly to tourists. The fish market was small, mainly for retail, nothing like what you would see in Tokyo, Hong Kong or Seoul. I didn't see any locals shopping there. All tourists.

you can buy nice big king crab there remember to ask for discount 3kg king crab cost only 7000yen, its very cheap compare to buy at my home city there is a small restaurant inside the market, you can eat nice sashimi and crab with very reasonable price

I read the Japanese review on this website. Most of them lamblasted this market but I don't think it deserves the bad reputation. I went there on a late Sunday morning, & gasps, the market was deserted. It certainly was not as crowded as Curb Market. And it was very small.

Been here twice for lunches and I really doubt there is any other place in the world that can offer you the same Japanese crab varieties, seafood freshness and value. This time we had an interesting find, two different types of Ikura (Salmon roe) which are marinated

google: A smaller market, which was nice to walk around. I ate some freshly grilled seafood.

Vibes 4/5
Food 5/5

For vibes, it is a little bit touristy while I was walking around, getting to know/see foreigners hanging around the area.

Food is really amazing. As this is a seafood market, it's only normal to visit for its seafood. …

Your standard but smaller scale wet market. A variety of fresh seafood on offer, however if you're seeking crabs, I recommend browsing three to four vendors to check average weight vs. price. You can bargain, but be fair with realistic …

So many hidden gems at the market. Best area to taste everything seafood. Remember to stand and or sit down and eat, extremely rude to be in motion and consume at the sometime. 

Hot milk and live cut shrimps were the my favourite. Don't forget a great bowl of don to taste the Uni, Scallops of Haikaiddo.

We, the Barcelona 6 plus two, had an amazing fresh sea food lunch here, just minutes upon our arrival in Sapporo...the gigantic crabs were still very much alive when we ordered them, although the huge claws and legs were the ones I was …

This market offers the freshest of seafoods that can be eaten right then and there. Price is just right and value for money for the freshest salmon and mackerel. Best to eat breakfast here as they are open as early as 7:00 in the morning.

Relatively small market, which is to be expected when it’s so central to the city I think, but loads of fresh seafood there! Went pretty early in the morning and there is a paid car park across the road, just pay the fee and hand your keys …
Fresh Seafood and also dry seafood take away or eat on site for some shops. Famous for King Crab and sea urchin. But those ate of course quite pricey.

Decent place to look for seafood. Not everything is fresh, some are flash frozen. Some shops offer shucking/cooking of seafood. There are a few small restaurants within the market itself if you are looking for a meal. Would recommend trying fresh oysters or scallops.
Short street of fresh produce market, no fishy smell at all. Great place to purchase fresh dried products as souvenirs and devour in crabs! Don't forget the alleys, which could be priced cheaper.

Very nice place to take a walk around (not very big) in the morning. Best is if your hotels doesn't come with breakfast, and you can grab it in one of the many restaurants here.

Some of the owners doesn't allow photography, but hey, it's their stall, their call.

Nice seafood market for eating fresh crab , oysters, shrimps and fruits. Just order your seafood and they will prepare them for you. And you can it in the store. Good price for good quality food. A little bit crowded but be patient and you will eat very good food from Hokkaido.
Nice collection of fresh and dried sea food. It felt a bit touristy though. We didn't see any locals buying from any of the shops. The shop keepers seemed friendly and communicative.

It's fresh and delicious, some prices is not cheap and some of the shop is not that polite.
Good food good taste but not have seat enough

Great fun! The stall holders definitely know their customers.... Mostly tourists, and they can pack everything for you very neatly for the journey with ice packs and foam boxes.

Try the sushi restaurants there, can't go wrong with any of them really.
Place to find some fresh product. Quite pricey
A great place to see lots of seafood, fresh fruit, and vegetables. Definitely very interesting and worth the visit+
Has some very cool stuff like crab, bear curry and whale bacon. Also has great sushi restaurants and fruit shops.
Lovely market to stroll and buy things..

Great historical Fish market located at the heart of downtown 

Love this friendly fish market, clean and neat, people are friendly, some of them able to speak English 

Prices are very reasonable 

Open 06:00 till 18:00

Good place for fresh Seafood breakfast, enjoy the fresh Urchin and red Salmon

I've been here about 5 times.  I don't think it's the freshest in everything but their service from many of the vendors are good. The ikura I was given to taste didn't taste like the bottles one I took home that was supposed to be the same.  It's worth going to due to the proximity to town.

Tourist trap. Everyone sells almost the same kind of crabs and shell fish. All tourists queue up for overly rated seafood dons (its all the same as long as the seafood is fresh!) . Merchants can be rude. Tourists etiquette is bad. Just head to the Sapporo Crab Market, better and more honest merchants.
Seafood market with dine in option, but quite a little that sell live seafood. I barely find one that have living crab. The seafood taste yummy. Price is reasonable
Very old seafood market. Interesting just to walk around but several places to eat alongside many stalls selling crab, scallops and lots of other Hokkaido seafoods.
Lots of seafood to choose from. You can eat them raw or barbequed on the spot. So delicious. Came across a stall selling crab meat bun. So tried one. It was average.

Talk about the king crab taste ? Its different with the other country crab thats so f.. delicious, the meat is sweet and thick
You must try by yourself,
The problem is the price its up to 5000 above

We went in winter and there's a store that sells hot milk/hot coffee in little glass bottles. I tried both and LOVED the hot coffee. Since we stayed near this market, we went every morning for a coffee before we began our day. I miss it so …

This place is awesome with fresh seafood, some stall come with restaurant, pick your choices of seafood and they will prepare it for you.

My personal favourite is the sea urchins (uni), fresh and have buttery texture, with natural sea …

With fresh seafood,  must visit in Sapporo City.  Highly recommended this Daiichi Kaisenmaru.  Small shop but with very high quality produce.

The fresh raw oyster I had,  the size is as big as the plate,  only cost me 200 yen.  Super worth it.  The taste is superb with a touch of lemon.

Well worth the visit. Much smaller than its Tokyo counterpart. But seafood was fresh. I found the shops at the fringe of the markets more worth while. Large oysters for 300 yen compared to smaller ones inside for 380 yen. Sushi shop in the market has omakase for 3k yen which was worth it.

Nice small market where you can pick which fresh seafood product you would want cooked and then eat right there at the shop. Rock bottom prices too. 

Have a more formal meal at the eateries located along the market premises.
Easy to come. Not big as you aspect but you can fine good and fresh product   next to the shopping road.
A small space that offers fresh seafood that is awesome! You can buy fresh or dried seafood there too! Fantastic quality!

Pretty good seafood market with lovely vendors. Choose some crab and they'll heat it up for you to eat inside one of their stores. BBQ scallops with soy butter sauce is delicious, the oysters are nice and creamy.

Don't recommend this place. Not a lot of booths opened anymore, vendors seem angry and frustrated at foreigners, and can you blame them when everyone is taking up all the sidewalk just taking selfies with the crabs? I tried one of the grilled oysters and scallops and was highly disappointed in the quality. It wasn't fresh at all.
Loved the fresh seafood cooked right before your eyes. Just shop around first and your sure to find something suitable if you are a seafood lover.
Clean. Fresh Seafood. Friendly people and reasonable price
Come here for the fresh oysters! They are so huge, fresh and affordable! Totally worth it.
Fresh seafood, sweet yubari melon..price can be bargain..interesting place
Couldn't be more local than this. A place to really try the local seafood. Really fresh and delicious
A small but really nice seafood market. Lots of restaurants and stores selling crab and other seafood. A must visit for breakfast.
The market is like any typical Japanese seafood market but there are many crabs. Lots of seafood restaurants to try the day's catch. Not cheap, but fresh and tasty.
Winter Feb, had the raw oyster and scallop. It was fresh and cracked open in front of me. The best!!!
Delicious fish bowl! A small secluded place, and the prices were good.

Not sure if it was because I went pretty late (around 9 am) on a weekday, not many shops were opened. A lot fewer people compared to Tsukiji though, so you could take your time to browse. Choices of seafood were very focused on uni, crab and scallops.
There are much better markets elsewhere but this might give you a taste if you don't get the chance.

This is a small seafood market. Arrived at 4.15pm on a Tuesday and some of the shops are getting ready to close and some already closed. 
However there are a number of shops still open. There are fresh and dried seafoods on sale. Prices are …
Enjoy fresh seafood from Hokkaido. Place is kind of similar to Tsukiji fish market but I felt the price is bit higher than Tsukiji. Anyway the sea food here is super fresh and delicious.
Very small market with loads of seafood.
Nice little seafood market selling mostly Hokkaido crabs and ikura. You can begin but all the food seems overpriced. Didn't seem to be too many locals shopping here.
Yummy Shashimi and grilled scallop. Must try.

Great place to see and have fresh Hokkaido seafood. Try the same eateries into the market. Great prices for fresh Uni 👍

Interesting old market that seems like a tourist trap. There is a long queue for a seafood bowl restaurant in the middle of the market.

Otherwise, shop owners were displaying a price on a calculator instead of abiding by a published price. …

Someone says it’s small and lack of choice. I say it is convenient and the seafood is fresh . Price is reasonable. I can see many local Japanese going there which means that it’s not a pure tourist market

One of good places to recommend when you are in Sapporo for the first time. Market is not very big as in Tokyo or in Kyoto, but there are good small restaurant for fresh seafoods near or in the market.
It was a very good place with a lot of choice of seafood. The shop open all the sheels in front of you just need to enjoy.
There're lot of fresh n live seafood for take away n eat in shashimi
Small seafood market. Good place for breakfast

Nijo market is much smaller in size in comparison with the better known tsukiji market, so a quick stroll for about 30 minutes will be enough to cover the whole place. There are tons of fresh seafood for sale with the option of being cooked on site. It is quite pricey though.
breakfast time!! everything so fresh and delicious!!

You know what? I can even sense the quality and taste before I had these foods.

 Altough photos may look nice to you, but I strongly recommend to leave this place after taking few shots you like , and find some other decent seafood …
A nice place to visit for seafood but expect lots of tourists and seeing similar souvenir oriented products over and over.

Is a one straight shopping street differentiate by 7 substreet at each crossing road.

狸小路 1 to 6 are shopping street
狸小路 7 is food street

狸小路 4 is Mega Donki 24 hours
The shop is besides Obihihro Pork Bowl Porco. Really nice and no need queue! Diagonally opposite the fish market!

A short walk from Odori Park and is quite easy to get too. There are many great selection of seafood to choose from. Not a big market compare with Hakodate Morning Market but I think is a good size. I had otoro Sashimi, Botan Prawn Sashimi, …

Nijo Market is not huge like other markets around. However if you are in Sapporo, you can drop by to enjoy the freshest seafood available. The scallop Sashimi is a must to try!

Highly recommended for travellers who looking for local authentic fresh seafood. Price at discount sometimes. Most shops close at about 4-5pm. We had fresh grilled king crab at the shop. We had a king crab for 3 of us for the price of …

Wow… traditional market is always interesting place to visit, this fresh market offer fresh-cut sashimi like the one in Tsukiji Market, Tokyo. Don't be miss, there's one popular ramen store by local near the west entrance of the market. …
Good place for seafood but Sankaku Market in Otaru is way better. The quality of seafood, prices in Otaru and places to eat at the market are a lot more convenient.
Place for seafood lover in Hokkaido. They offered good quality and varieties of seafood at reasonable price. There was a shop at the corner that offered really good crab set menu.

A great small market with tons of seafood and a good amount of fruit. We bought a slice of melon and a crab leg at one of the stands. Both were excellent. They had a little seating area to enjoy the food. Staff were so friendly.

Great range of seafood, but don't expect prices to be cheap here. Nice alternative to the bigger markets in the area.

the market located in 20 minutes walk distance from sapporo station.
